Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: TigerGirl11
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect, and the hotel and rooms are clean. My room was pretty spacious but was in need of updating.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great people, a few small improvements needed”
Reviews.Author: Matt K
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Wyndham for a Spring Break trip that coincided with a one day meeting. Front desk staff was wonderful, as well as the service staff. Russell, the concierge, worked his tail off for my family - a real life saver! Josh, who answers comments in this forum, made sure that our room was exactly as it was supposed to be with a pull out couch and a crib. I emailed him prior to our stay and he got back to me within a day. We were in one of the suites, which had plenty of room for me, my wife, and 3 kids. Rooms need a little bit of work, as TVs are CRT, the furnishings are a little plain, and walls need some touch ups, but they say that those renovations are coming soon. The beds are very comfortable, though. I would personally like to see iHome iPod compatible alarm clocks, but that's just me. Room temperature was perfect even on an 80 degree day. Once the place gets a face lift, it will be a real gem just a block off the mile and in a central location to just about everything you want to visit. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to Stay in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: DebbieAustin
Reviews.Content: This is a great location to stay in for a visit to Chicago! Just a block or so from Michigan Street and Water Tower place, plus easy walking distance to the beach, blues and great restaurants. The staff were excellent, and responsive to our needs. They have a great indoor pool, hot tub and sauna (wet and dry) plus workout area!!

Reviews.Title: “I don't recommend”
Reviews.Author: detr
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel is clean and the staff are nice. Perfect location. The rooms are outdated.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Roach19
Reviews.Content: Came to this hotel for a group trip. The location was nice, walking distance to everything we needed. We had a room with two beds that appeared to be double beds but should have been queen size, especially since we had to share beds. Beds were comfortable though. Our room was missing the coffee maker even though the coffee and tea was still provided in our room. The room had a nice size washroom and was fairly clean. The wireless was $10 a day so we had to borrow wireless from a nearby hotel. There was no complementary breakfest so we ate elsewhere in the mornings. Overall the rest of the hotel was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Blinds in the room”
Reviews.Author: dcords
Reviews.Content: Hello, booked this hotel for 3/2/12-3/4/12 on Hotwire. First the staff I meet with were all VERY nice and helpful! I had booked for three guys and had called ahead asking for a room if possible to accommodate us with separate beds. Upon checking in we were given a room with two full size beds and a option to add a cot at extra cost. Glad I brought mine. The room was big and clean but needs updating like most of the hotel. The drapes in the room did not completely cover the window so the morning light easily came in the room and woke me up. There is NO free internet even in the business center! unless you can get one of the concierge to unlock there computer . Also it should be noted that the hotel is across the street from a hospital so ambulance noise is real and annoying.... Other than that good stay Hotwire 4 star my rating is 3.5.

Reviews.Title: “Nice value for a clean renovated hotel...but service a bit lacking”
Reviews.Author: Chile4me
Reviews.Content: I found a fantastic Chicago winter rate at the Wyndham Magnificent Mile in Downtown CHI Town. This was a work trip that came up and I had very little time to price compare and little time to plan. The room was clean, renovated and fairly spacious. Location was awesome. By the time we arrived, handed my keys to valet (typical $55 valet parking charge for downtown CHI), and checked in I was exhausted...yet we were in Chicago so we had to search out good food, right? On our way to our rooms we stopped by the concierge desk to ask about good dinner options that were within easy walking distance. Note...even if it is an unseasonable winter in the Midwest, cold windy city weather off of Lake Michigan is still cold. Most of my tried and true dinner options required a bit of a walk or transpo (aka Frontera and Greek Islands come to mind, there are others...but those are two of my faves). There was no one at the concierge desk when we arrived. We waited 10 minutes before a staff person walked by and asked if we needed any assistance...duh. He was sweet but informed us that there was no concierge on duty (really...no sign? really? it was only ~ 6pm on a weekday?) he was also new to the city so he referred us to the front desk. I walked back to the front desk, obtained a restaurant list, then proceeded to drop my luggage off in my decently appointed room. Ethnic is awesome and Spanish Tapas is something that we can't get at home in Madison, WI. We walked 5-6 blocks in biting, windy-city cold only to learn from a neighboring hotel bellhop that the place had "been closed for several months". At this point, we walked so faraway from the Mag mile, our hotel and our "known" faves that we just started looking for something that was easy with good flavor. We ended up walking up Division an hit Lou Malnatti's. Another good fave with Italian flavor...so we hit it. We walked back to the hotel. I logged in to email. I really wanted Midwestern free WIFI. It didn't happen so I went to bed, slept well, got up, woke up, checked out, crossed the street to the Corner Bakery for breakfast and free WIFI and worked for a few hours. Overall, this is a great room and great location for a great value ($99 +$55 for parking). I would pick this up for a leisure trip without any question...I would have time to research dinner and entertainment options. For a work business trip with limited time I would have paid a bit more for more service .

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in a nice city”
Reviews.Author: alessandro f
Reviews.Content: my wife and i went there for a night and we were surprised about the size of the room that we stayed in.it was really big and clean.Also the rest of the hotel was clean and the staff was nice. the only thing that for me wasn't right was the price of the parking: 54$ against 98$ of the room. so my advice is to park the car close to the hotel where you can save 30$ and have a drink somewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: camillenesler
Reviews.Content: Really close to everything on Michigan Ave, loved walking around and seeing all the Christmas lights! The room was gorgeous and the beds really comfortable. Was also an easy walk to Navy Pier. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A++”
Reviews.Author: C_Pennell_11
Reviews.Content: The Wyndham is a great hotel, location is perfect. Lots of restaurants and pubs near by, conveniently located near bus routes and the subway. Hotel staff were nice and the concierge were very informative. All in all I would recommend this hotel to everyone who visits Chicago

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: easilyconfused
Reviews.Content: The Wyndham Chicago is a lovely hotel but the location is unbeatable. We could see the Magnificent Mile from our window. As stated in other reviews, the rooms are desperately in need of an update, but our bathroom was gorgeous. The noise wasn't much of an issue for us since we live in a major metro area and hear sirens normally. We did have an issue with our room keys deactivating and not reading through our door. The staff was quick to help us out and sent an engineer up with us at one point. Every staff member was very courteous and for a quick weekend away it was all that was needed.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: thatbchick
Reviews.Content: Place needs updating & it could have been a little cleaner (carpet stains, stains on our restroom floor), but overfall it is a fine place to lay your head after hanging in Chicago. It's a great location too!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Terrible room amenities”
Reviews.Author: RedWings42794
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wyndham Chicago last weekend and were very disappointed with the room amenities. We stayed in handicapped suite #513 due to the fact that my girlfriend had a broken ankle. Starting witht he bathroom: the towel rack was loose and ready to fall off the wall, the handicap rails wobbled and didn't appear very sturdy and the swing mirror/light was broke. Livingroom: Overall we were very pleased with the large size of the suite, however were very disappointed with the amenitites. The furniture appeared very old and had snags in it . The table had a loose leg and major scratches in it. The suite had a coolbox (only cooled to 50*) instead of a refrigerator (I have never seen this before, especially in a suite) and the tvs need to be upgraded badly. Overall we were pleased with the service, the lobby was clean and the bellman/valet were great, but I expect much more out of a hotel a block off of Michigan Avenue in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Third World”
Reviews.Author: Phoenix Q
Reviews.Content: Third World is the closest I can come to best describe the experience. I travel to Chicago weekly and tried this hotel because it claimed to be 4 star. Agreed with 'keebj86' the 4 star rating does not apply to the rooms. There was no heat in the room, my hands were cold and I stayed wrapped in a blanket. I requested a refrigerator in my room. They brought me a refrigerator that seemed like it came from a thrift store. The front desk told me there was something wrong with the heat and in the morning told me they did not know when it would be fixed. At that point I decided to check out and complained that I wanted a refund for my night with no heat, but was not accommodated. I woke up in pain from the cold and a migraine also from the cold room. I was told the manager Josh would call me to compensate me for the experience with a discount or something which never happened. I was greatly disappointed in this Third World experience. This hotel is NOT 4 Star.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: sunshineboltie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located one block off of Michigan Ave and very centrally located with equal amounts of shopping in either direction. Our room had a living space and a bedroom, which was nice. The room was clean and the bedding was nice-down or downlike comforter and pillows. The bathroom layout was pretty odd, but there was plenty of counter space and a make up mirror. Wifi is not included and there is no refridgerator. There is a "cooling" box and I am not sure what that is about. The coffee is a one pot machine and the coffee itself is not very good. There is a coffee shop across the street. All in all, it is a pretty basic hotel, with a restaurant and bar, but I would recommend it for its location and cleanliness and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This is the LOUDEST hotel I ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: mbialczak
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a serious issue with sound... It's loud! I did not get a good nights sleep. I knew about the hospital nearby, and expected the sirens. I did not know about the slamming doors. I could hear every door in our hallway closing, including conversations in the hallway. Also, there was no light deadening blinds, just a sheer. There is a building across the street, so lack of privacy. There is no deadbolt on the door either, just a door chain. If you are looking at this hotel for a good night's sleep, keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: keebj86
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wyndham over a long weekend in Chicago and were less than impressed on our experience. The 4 star rating may apply to the lobby, ballrooms, etc, but not the rooms. We booked a room for 4 and received a room with 2 full beds -- I thought Queen would have been standard. The beds were uncomfortably hard. The sheets were clean, but old. One of the sets of sheets had ink stain on it. The bathroom was large, but the shower could use some work. The shower head was low, old and so covered with mineral deposits it did not give a very good stream of water. Those problems would have been easy to overlook, given its convenient location to Michigan Avenue, but the service was also poor. On the first night we requested an additional set of sheets around 10 PM. After not receiving, we called again at 11 PM and were told that they would bring them right up. Finally at midnight I went to the front desk and had to get them myself. The next day they took the towels out of the bathroom while cleaning and did not replace them. Not good.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: travel09Ontario
Reviews.Content: Perfect location. Middle of all the action. Large room at a good price. Will certainly stay there again on our next visit to Chicago

Reviews.Title: “Nice spot”
Reviews.Author: ITA_And_RE_a
Reviews.Content: While very nice in many respects, this hotel is imediatey adjacent to the Northwetsern memorail Hospital emergency room entrance. Very noisy with ambulances arriving hourly. if you are visiting the hospital however its perfect Didn't spend a lot of time in the hotel, but the location was good and the restaurant advice from the concierge was great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel off Michigan Ave”
Reviews.Author: PhilipL4
Reviews.Content: The hotels one block off of Michigan Ave offer a much better value than staying right on the street. Room was big, clean and the staff was very courteous. I think that at a certain level, the staff makes or breaks a hotel. We've stayed in several hotels in downtown Chicago. This and the Courtyard have been the least expensive. I may prefer the Courtyard for the outward helpfulness of the staff. One nit about the Wyndham property: the room elevators don't go to ground level. One has to tak it to the 2nd floor, walk down the hall to the lobby and either take a stair or another elevator to get out. There is a Corner Bakery across the street, which is always nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay, rooms could use updating”
Reviews.Author: DragonwMatches
Reviews.Content: We booked a Groupon for a one-night, one-room suite stay in December with my wife & 6 year old daughter. We like a suite layout as we can put the kid to bed and stay up for a little while. We've stayed at the Omni on Michigan Ave several times and like it, but this Wyndham suite was far bigger and more spread out, making the separation between the living room/kids bedroom and our bedroom much farther and thus a little more comfortable - plenty of space and we didn't have to be as worried about making noise to wake her up. The carpet was worn out and could use replacing, and the paper on the walls was outdated, but we had no issues with the room itself. The bathroom was oddly laid out as you walk in the room and are instantly greeted by a wall jutting through the middle, which separates the sinks from the toilet/shower. The shower/tub showed its age, but did the job. The location of the hotel is great - you're one block off Michigan Ave and a short cab ride (or walk if you like to walk) to Navy Pier.

Reviews.Title: “Not 5 Star”
Reviews.Author: Chris T
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last year (May of 2011), booked for two nights, and walked out after the first night based on the horrible experience. In other words, it was worth my forfeiting the paid-for second night and thus essentially paying double to stay anywhere else. The service was horrendous - front desk was rude, valet staff was completely indifferent (and didn't hold the door for my girlfriend, as they were too busy chatting), and the waitress in the restaurant took 15 minutes to stop by our table and bring us water - in an empty room at 3pm in the afternoon! The room was very average - not particularly large or luxurious in terms of a suite, but absolutely nothing better then 3 star. We stayed at the Hyatt on Wacker the night before, and there was no comparison. This hotel has actually caused me to completely avoid Priceline, as calling this Wyndham 5 star is absurd.

Reviews.Title: “Everyone greeted us and were extremely courteous.”
Reviews.Author: atimeframe
Reviews.Content: From the bellhop, valet and check in all personnel were extremely courteous and helpful. I can't say that of the guests! Everyone we met in the elevators or on the floor was rude! Very unfriendly according to our Southern standards. The hotel can't help that! And maybe it's a Chicago-thing! The hotel restaurant was very good both for dinner and breakfast. They have a very healthy breakfast menu of yogurt, granola and fruit; plus, of course everything else. The hotel worked for us because we needed to stay north of the city. The rate was excellent and they even accommodated a change in our reservation from a king to two beds with an additional guest at no additional charge.

Reviews.Title: “Sorely needs updating”
Reviews.Author: Carmollin
Reviews.Content: Nice location and nice staff, but the place needs serious attention. We got a good deal through Groupon for our family stay in December, but if I'd paid full price I would have been bummed out. I was also happy we were only staying 1 night.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but the hotel and staff need work!”
Reviews.Author: Shel-NYC
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located near Michigan Ave and Northwestern medical center, a decent waling distance from the L train. Staff was rude during check-in. Internet connection very expensive ($11 per day) and SLOW. Rooms need basic repairs-- carpet is peeling off, floorboards exposed. I expected more from the Wyndham name.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Hawkeye74_8
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located one block from Michigan Ave and convenient to shopping and restaurants. Rooms and staff are excellent all round. The only thing negative is that some of the common areas (elevators and hallways) need to be updated.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location..helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: kayoung1
Reviews.Content: We checked in on a Friday afternoon and had a 2 double bed room. It was large enough for 2 people and the bathroom was also large and accomodating. The concierge were helpful in directing us to restaurants in the area. It is approximately 1 or 2 blocks from Michigan Ave. Easily walkable. Even though we were close to hospital noise was not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great place - Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: Sofija1
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect! Right in the middle of all shops and restaurants. Staff is great and rooms are clean and large. Overall, an excellent experience. Would recommend to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “worst wyndham I have ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: stacy436
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in November. I have stayed at several other Wyndham Hotels all over the US, THIS WAS THE WORST! The hotel is 1/2 a blcok away from the hospital & we were on the 4th floor on the corner looking out over the street. Needless to say we were woken up every time an ambulance went by (which was often!). When we asked to change rooms after the first night the desk clerk was rude. The hotel is run down and badly in need of a renovation. There are so many nice places to stay in Chicago for close to the same price DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good stay”
Reviews.Author: STURGISFAMILY
Reviews.Content: The Wyndham is an impressive property and the common areas are lovely. We stayed with our 11 year old son in a King Suite. The room; although the furnishings are very tired looking and the TV's are ancient; was HUGE...The King Bed was extremely comfortable. The Sofa Bed was very uncomfortable. In their defense, I understand a renovation/update is in the near future. Nice touch with Bath Robes provided. Location could not be much better. We were able to walk to Water Tower, Crate and Barrel, Nike Town, Starbucks, etc. The Concierge was extremely helpful in recommending an awesome kid friendly restaurant and even helped in getting us priority seating. Go to Gino's Pizza...you won't be disappointed. Overall, it was a nice stay. I would stay here again post update/renovation of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Accommodating!”
Reviews.Author: jon s
Reviews.Content: Wyndam is a block off Michigan near the heart of mag mile. Rooms were average and tvs tube. We took advantage of a corner king for $20/day upgrade charge. Worth it. Carpets need cleaning. Views obstructed by surrounding buildings. Northside of building faces northwestern mem hospital so sirens were plentiful. Eastside faces building and a construction site was 500 yards away. Fitness room adequate but parents and kids file through on the way to the small pool and sauna...not relaxing for people who left their kids at home. Concierge service was helpful and went the extra mile to book during the holiday week. Taxis omnipresent and it's next to a corner bakery and 7 eleven. The hotel is ok but when we return we will likely try something else.

Reviews.Title: “room was big, but view was poor”
Reviews.Author: lurlene
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal from Groupon for this hotel, so decided to take the kids for a mini vacation over Christmas break. The room was very big, it was nice to have a separate room that closes off from the living room with the fold out bed so our tv didn't keep the kids awake. We were hoping for a great view, however, the only thing we had a good view of was offices across the street, close enough that we felt we had to keep the curtains pulled even during the daytime. The location was excellent, right off of Michigan Avenue. The breakfast buffet was expensive, so we decided room service was a better value. Still expensive, but the kids enjoyed it. However, because it was still so expensive, probably would go to Corner Bakery next time, we just were unsure if our picky eaters would find something they liked there. Another reviewer wrote that the pool was the size of a postage stamp, I would definitely have to agree. I had promised the kids we would go swimming at night, got there at 9pm, and the pool was so full of kids in such a tiny space that we just had to say no and go up to the room and rent a movie instead. To me, there is no point of having a pool if it is going to be this small and in such a small, dark area. However, a lot of families probably won't go to a hotel without a pool, so I'm thinking this is why they put in this tiny pool. Overall, with the Groupon, this was an excellent deal and we would stay again, and just not plan on going swimming. However, if I had to pay full price, would definitely not pay that much.

Reviews.Title: “King Suite - nice size, great staff, great location - rooms need updating”
Reviews.Author: swede52497
Reviews.Content: King size bed, suite - nice for spreading out but rooms are in need of updating. Nothing exceptional, just average. Bedroom closes off from the front living room which has a pull out bed (those things should be banned). TV's in both rooms. Location is exceptional for anyone looking to be centrally located i.e., Michigan Ave, Theatre District, Navy Pier, Grant Park, etc. Northwestern Hospital across the street. Valet at $42/for 24 hours. Just leave your car and cab it everywhere. Do not expect any great reviews for pool (just a warning if you have kids). Extremely small and cramped. Exercise facility average.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: jansak10
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Chicago to a family wedding. It is a great hotel close to Michigan Mile and central. The staff were superb. The wedding reception was in the Ballroom in hotel and the service and food were excellent. We would definitely stay there again. The rooms were clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “NICE LOCATION, ROOMS NEED UPDATE”
Reviews.Author: americal7071
Reviews.Content: Spent this past weekend at this property. Service was very good. Location is great. Very near water tower place and other shopping malls on Michigan Avenue. Two complaints however. The room we had faced South and we were on the 6th floor. Sirens awoke us a few times. Northwestern Hospital is across the street on the North side of the property. The room we were in 631, needs updating. In the sitting area the carpet is stained, the couch cushions are worn and have no cushioning effect left. No flat screen tvs here. Old Phillips crts. Time to put some money into this place. Had drinks in the bar. Friendly waiter and nice quiet atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Still Love the Wyndham!”
Reviews.Author: shari682
Reviews.Content: This is our favorite hotel in Chicago and this is our third stay in the last 12 months. We love it here, whether my husband and I are traveling alone, or whether we have our kids with us. This time we had a very early flight and we were at the Wyndham at 7:30 a.m. on our check-in day. We were pleasantly surprised when we were told that we were able to check in!! What a great way to start our trip. I also spoke with the By-Request Manager before we arrived in Chicago and she had us blocked for one of the corner king suites. This hotel is great and I can't say enough nice things about it. We will continue coming back. The rooms are starting to show their age though and the furnishings in the room could use an upgrade, but I read in another post that the Wyndham will be undergoing a renovation in 2012. Can't wait to come back! We've stayed at a lot of hotels in the past, and this is the one we keep coming back to. Great location, wonderful staff!

Reviews.Title: “An unexpected perk- thanks Wyndham!”
Reviews.Author: amusedcreations
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Chicago at 4:30 am and expected to leave our bags in the hotel lobby and wander around the city until check in time. We were overwhelmed when the lady at the front desk let us check in at 5:00 am and head to our room! What bliss to have a shower and fall into the very comfortable bed for a post flight nap. We woke up a few hours later and were energized for exploring wonderful downtown Chicago. The hotel is located only a block or so from the middle of the Magnificent Mile and is handy for a good walk to the Navy Pier. The room was clean and efficient- the exhaust pipes on a roof a few floors below would have bothered light sleepers - i'd caution people to double check your room location when setting up a reservation.. We enjoyed our stay and greatly appreciated being able to have early access to a room after an overnight flight!

Reviews.Title: “Ok stay”
Reviews.Author: Jon M
Reviews.Content: the room was large but underutilized, but the carpet had stains, very basic television set, the room was cold and took 2 days to get to a decent temperature. the hotel is outdated, all the lobby looks nice. alos the hotel is across from the hospital so, there is a constant barrage of ambulences and emergency vehicles coming in at out. the food there is good though

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kimo688889
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location for the Michigan Avenue shopper not venturing past Water Tower Place. You can access the Mag Mile, Northwestern University Hospital and the lakeshore from this welll located place. Wife and I went there for Christmas shopping and it was great. Valet and check in was professional and quick. I got a good rate even though it was close to Christmas. Very helpful and friendly staff. All around, this is a great hotel. One drawback: across the street from emergency room of major hospital, expect to be waken up periodically with sirens from ambulances. Good new though, because if you need medical help you can walk across the street. I would stay there again in a heartbeat

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: kristal g
Reviews.Content: I cannot say a bad word about this hotel. PERFECT location, PERFECT price. Was a great size room with adequate fitness and pool facilities for a short stay. The concierge team was amazing, the best Ive come across in any hotel. They couldn't do enough for you. Would highly recommend to anyone and will be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon???”
Reviews.Author: Cherry B
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband decided to stay in Chicago and honeymoon at the Wyndham. We purchase a king suite through Groupon. in our 4 night stay, we had to change rooms 3 times. You can image how we felt on our honeymoon, frustrated. On our first night, our room was extremely cold. After an hour of no response we call again. We were then changed to a much smaller room for the night. The staff tried to convince us that most people, like the smaller room better. The next day, we were put in another king suite, which was smaller than the original. Everything after that, we were pretty much pissed. The Wyndham need to be updated, we waited about 20 minutes for the bellboyto get our bags, amongst of other irritating things. However, I would say we were compensated through free breakfast and parking. This was after several negotiations. the hotel was pretty cool but after all that we experience on our honeymoon, were not sure if we will visit them again.

Reviews.Title: “An Evening at the Wyndham”
Reviews.Author: reddragonflygirl
Reviews.Content: This was our second time at the Wyndham...Our rooms both times were clean, comfortable, and the bathrooms spotless!...Being downtown Chicago you will want to ask for a room away from the busy street...This last stay our room over looked St Claire Street...We heard sirens all night! Having a room on this end of the building, sleep can not be a requirement...When reserving your stay remember to add an aditional $52.00 a night for parking at the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Soo30t
Reviews.Content: Visited during Thanksgiving with the intention of watching the parade and doing big shopping! Very well positioned hotel for shops, bars and restaurants. Paid about 70 pounds a night which was good value. Nicely sized room and very clean. Wouldn't recommend the bar as very dark and could hardly read the wine list, eventually ordered and then they didn't have the wine I wanted. Hotel staff are very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive hotel; not very special”
Reviews.Author: bikkel16
Reviews.Content: Let me start with the positive points: the location is perfect. Just a few blocks away from the center. The room is big enough, beds o.k. and there is just a little bit of noise from your neighbors. Negative: Breakfast is too expensive. Better go to the bakery outside. It is much better and a better price. Inside the room it is old fashioned; dark furniture, bathroom is o.k but not special, and television is from many years ago. Wifi is not free; unbelievable in 2011 !

Reviews.Title: “Comfy, good deal”
Reviews.Author: DunesMom
Reviews.Content: Two adults stayed November 2011. I called hotel directly and got a great deal ($109), but I thought we were getting a corner king ( junior suite), what we really got was a standard with a note to upgrade if available. Of course, the upgrade was not. I had to coaxe the unfriendly woman at the desk to find a king bed, at least, for my husband and I. The room is not glamorous, but the bed and bedding were very comfortable and clean. The pillows were some of the best I have had in a hotel. The bathroom was nice with granite sink and marble floors. The towels were soft, fluffy and evn smelled fresh. The Tru Blu Spa soap amenities however, have an awful, overpowering masculine scent which sticks to your person and clashes with any fragrance you might be wearing. Bring your own soaps. The tv was not flat screen. There is a complimentary "cool box", not exactly a fridge but close, in the room. No mini bar. WiFi costs an extra $10, and kept fading in and out. We asked for a refund on that, which we were given. We stayed in a high floor xx10 room which faces west toward city buildings. Not a bad view. The ambulance noises were no more than one might normally hear in a big city, even though the hospital is across the street. Valet parking is $52/night w/in-out priv., but we parked a block away in the Northwestern Hospital associated garage (at Huron /St.Clair) which is only $40/24 hours, no in out priv.

Reviews.Title: “All is good, but the food and wifi”
Reviews.Author: Bahadir
Reviews.Content: This is a very centrally located hotel, only few minutes walk from the Magnificent Mile. The room was nice, and quite. The reception and concierge staff were kind and helpful. However there are two aspects of this stay which was less than optimal 1) Wi-fi = Although you have to pay for the wi-fi, the connection was so slow. I had to stayed hours (not exaggerating) on front of my computer trying to download my emails 2) Food was disappointing. I had a dinner at my room coming from the hotel restaurant (Calliterra). I tasted only one spoon from the asparagus soup, and could not possibly finish it. The presention of steak was also not pretty, it was mixed up with sause and mashed potatoes (not the best food scene). The breakfast is also served in the same restaurant and is equally disappointing. The buffet offers a very limited choice, and there is no fresh juices. I had to stick to salmon and bagel every morning. Coffee tasted like mud, and there was no expresso available (even if you are prepared to pay for extra). I would strongly recommend ignoring this restaurant altogether, and go elsewhere for any meal (dinner or breakfast) if you have time.

Reviews.Title: “Good location.”
Reviews.Author: Carol F
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wyndham while attending a reunion event for Northwestern. There were a few of us so we needed two rooms. We made our reservations two months ahead of time and requested adjoining rooms or rooms very close together. I confirmed my reservations and requests the week before our arrival. When we tried to check in at 5:00pm our rooms were not ready. We went a did a little window shopping and were able to check in when we returned about an hour later. Our rooms were very far apart and they did not give us the type of room we needed (2)beds for one of the reservations. We called down to the desk and the apologized profusely and said they sould correct the issue immediately. We were given an upgrade to a suite -- a little closer to our travel partners. The room was HUGE with a separate bedroom. The bedroom was fine, but the living room area was about three times the size of the bedroom with a badly stained sofa and two very mismatched chairs. On the opposite side of the room was a small tv in an armoir which was almost impossible to watch from the far away sofa. There was a small desk and chair and a lot of mis matched art. The room could have used a couple dozen more pieces of furniture and not looked filled up. It was very odd. The hallway carpeting and the carpets in our rooms were stained. It just looked like it needed a major remodel. The lobby was great and the concierge was very helpful. We ate breakfast in the hotel restaurant and it was delicious and the service was very good. The location of this hotel is fantastic! Lots to do within walking distance, but It is very near Northwestern hospital so it is very noisy at night with lots of sirens. There ar so many amzaing hotels in Chicago. I don't think I would stay here again until it gets fixed up a bit. It was definitely too expensive for the rooms we were given and the hassle at check in.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: CAWeekender29
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Wyndham was comfortable throughout. Check in was quick, there was plenty of cardio equipment in the gym, a comfy bed, decent counter space in the bathroom and a comfortable restaurant with good menu selection. The location is also fantastic if you want to go shopping. It was just what I expected, although not much more. I imagine this would be a great place to stay for a shopping weekend because of the close walk to shopping and large entryway to store bags of clothes...although it could be inconvenient to take two elevators to drop things in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Hotel great location!”
Reviews.Author: Dusty078
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for 1 night on our recent trip to the US. Staff were very accommodating and helpful. Valet parking available. Pool area small but has sauna and steam room which we used first thing in the morning and had it to ourselves! Ate in the Hotel restaurant on their special steak promotion and this was one of the best fillet steaks i have had! Great location for shopping as the "magnificient mile" was a 2 minute walk away. Navy Pier about a 10 minute brisk walk away. Room was excellent, clean and comfy. Bed was superbly comfy! would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: KimSch13
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Wyndham Hotel this weekend and had the absolute best time! From the service of the staff to the guestrooms appearance, all was incredible. The location of the hotel can not be beat. We were just one block from Michigan avenue and all of the shopping and right near Navy Pier!

Reviews.Title: “Our Windy City Trip”
Reviews.Author: HappyMother921
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself, and our girls took a long weekend trip to Chicago and stayed at the Wyndham Chicago. It was our first trip ever to Chicago so we wanted to visit the American Girl Doll store. Rosa,The girl who made our reservation was wonderful and we ended up booking the American Girl Package at the hotel. It was so much fun the staff was so friendly and made us feel so special! we will now make this trip to Chicago a yearly event and of course stay at the Wyndham Chicago! The Caliterra was wonderful as well, for a hotel restaurant the price was right and the food was great!

Reviews.Title: “Wyndham in downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: m00nlight02
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about 1 hour train ride from O'Hare International airport, 6 blocks from the Red Line, and 1 block from the Magnificent Mile for those who enjoy shopping. It is a 4-star hotel so needless to say, a very nice place to stay. Of course, there is no free WiFi

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel Convenient to Downtown Life”
Reviews.Author: sweetie49321
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Wyndham for a romantic Chicago getaway and loved it! The room was great with big windows overlooking the city. The bed was very comfortable as well! I would highly reccommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Decent digs in downtown”
Reviews.Author: JCSmillie
Reviews.Content: First let me say I might be inclined to be a bit harsher had we not been using some credits my husband had to bring down our room cost considerably. As it was, we ended up paying about $450 out of pocket for two rooms, two nights -- and on a weekend when cheap rooms seemed hard to come by, that was as good as it got. Location-wise, we'd no complaints. Traveling with two nieces - 9 and 13 - being close to shopping, restaurants and attractions was crucial. The ability to walk a couple blocks to Michigan Ave. proved a real winner. I still think parking prices are exorbitant in downtown Chicago, but we saved about $12 per night off the hotel's valet rate by parking overnight in the hospital garage across the street. (However, it's worth noting that we weren't going in and out, a privilege the former would have allowed us.) I admit that I was a little thrown on first impression. The situation with the reception on the second floor is a tad odd and when we arrived there was a crazy-busy conference reception happening and the noise was insane. We took the elevator up to the sixth floor and the state of the carpets was abysmal and had me seriously worried about the rooms. There were enormous dark stains on the carpet. That said, the rooms actually turned out to be just fine. They were clean and relatively well-kept, although I'd say the double beds ran small and were not terribly comfortable. And I have to give credit to the housekeeping staff - by a couple of hours into our stay they had removed almost all the stains from the carpeting. (By the next day, a couple of fresh ones appeared which made me fear the stains said far more about the behavior of guests than the level of staff attention.) Pool is small, but serviceable. The hot tub wasn't particularly hot. Sauna and steam room are nice touches, although the former had stopped working by the second night of our trip. The staff were very polite the entire time. No complaints there. Wouldn't be my first choice of a place to stay in Chicago, but since we were looking for a good deal, I think we got our money's worth.

Reviews.Title: “Be ready for noise”
Reviews.Author: rayraysevn
Reviews.Content: If you are in Chicago for a quick weekend getaway, this hotel has a great location. 5 minute walk from the Magnificent Mile and a 10 minute walk to Navy Pier. Also, their concierge staff is AMAZING! They had great suggestions, gave us a lot of shopping and dinner coupons, and had great recommendations for my boyfriend and me. However, the downside is that it is right next to Northwestern Memorial Hospital which is a trauma center meaning sirens at all hours. We asked to face away from the hospital on a top floor (like I had read elsewhere on here) and that helped. Bring earplugs is all I can say! If you need trendy or boutique-y, this is not your hotel. If you want comfort and easy access to shopping, you are in luck!

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable staff and rooms, carpets stained”
Reviews.Author: dlmr1
Reviews.Content: I was on a business trip, and this was the hotel I had available to me. The staff were generally friendly and helpful, and the restaurant was very good. However, the carpets appeared to be stained and dirty, especially along the hallways. They were using carpet dryers on more than one floor (maybe they were having trouble with water leaks?) Also, the tub drain was completely clogged. When I asked for it to be fixed, the front desk informed me I had to be present for the engineer to come up. Since I was supposed to be in meetings all day, I was disappointed they could not find a way to make repairs without me having to wait almost an hour on business time for this to occur. (Of note, the engineer was very friendly and professional.) Maybe they could have a security guard accompany him next time? Anyways, the bed was comfortable and the climate control was great.

Reviews.Title: “I loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: domare
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with my stay at the Wyndham in Chicago. The staff were professional, pleasant and friendly. The room was very large, clean and comfortable. As a single woman traveler, I appreciated the security feature on the elevators which required using one's room key to access the floors with rooms. The hotel is one block from the Magnificent Mile so it is a great location but quieter than some of the hotels on Michigan Avenue. All-in-all, a great experience! Since I started reading Trip Advisor reviews, I have learned to check features that I would not necessarily notice. For those people who care, the carpets in the hallway on my floor were stained. I did not care but other travelers might.....

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: katydid1974
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night the weekend of the Chicago marathon before my family came up to meet me. I got a good deal on Hotels.com ($150) and it was within walking distance to the location I needed to be at on Saturday morning. I agree with some of the previous reviews that the hotel could use some updating, there were some worn spots in the carpet, etc.. However, the wonderful staff more than made up for it! I was always greeted with a smile and was even remembered by the doorman after leaving to head out to dinner. Everyone was very friendly and offered to assist in any way. The room itself was decent. I had a king and the bed was comfortable and I enjoyed the size of the room with the high ceilings. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the money”
Reviews.Author: jason h
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Wyndam Chicago this past weekend. We chose this hotel because it was the cheapest we could find in this area (150.00 nt on Hotwire). Location is good, beds and pillows were comfortable. Bathrooms are average, like something that you would find in Holiday inn etc. There is zero energy in the hotel, very boring. A good place to stay if you are looking for central location but not the spot for honeymoon or special weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Made the most of the rainy/cold weather”
Reviews.Author: charndaddy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were visiting between 9/24-9/26 and snagged one of the travelzoo deals being offered a few months prior to our trip. Was a little hesitant at first but based on what the other hotels cost during this time of month, the deal we got was a no brainer on top of the fact that it sits right in the middle of everything. Literally was 1 block from all the shopping of North Michigan avenue and close to many accessible bus stops. Pros: Room. We arrived early around 830am and was hoping to check in early than the 4pm check in time on our reservation. No problem there. Jordan the front desk person hooked it up and we were in our room in a matter of minutes. The room was huge, like a suite. First half was a living room type area with a couch and TV. We hardly spent any time in it and down the hall way was the bathroom and the large bedroom with another TV and nice view with a descent view of the city. We were on the 4th floor right next to the gym and swimming pool. Staff: Both the front desk and concierge's were awesome. Russell, Kaitlen, and another young gentlemen (forgot your buddy sorry) were always very welcoming in the mornings and evenings when we would pass by their desk and ask how our day went and what he had planned. If we wern't so tired from walking everywhere and getting up so early both days, we would have took them up on some of the nightlife entertainment hookups they had to some of the nice lounges/clubs. Cons: Not many but if I had to mention one thing it would be the lack of a true refridgerator. There is a fridge looking thing in the room but is only used to temporarily keep things cool. It would have cost us an additional $15 a day to have one delivered from housekeeping. Would have been nice to store some of our yummy leftovers to snack on but ended up throwing it all away. Also the TV's were pretty outdated but then again, by the time we got back from a long day outside, our eyes were too tired to pay attention to the quality of the monitor. Personal suggestions: 1) Purchase an unlimited CTA pass (for metro and bus) from the airport. We took the orange line from Midway Airport all the way to the Rosevelt stop and just hopped on the bus which took us a block away from our hotel in front of the coach store (ontario and michigan). Was very conveneint and affordable. A 3 day unlimited pass will cost you $14. We used my wife's Google App on her phone to figure out the most optimal transit routes to take (bus/metro/walking) to get from point A to B. Very helpful. 2) Take the architectural boat toar suggested by the concierges. It was about $38 per person and was a great way to city all the different buildings. Unfortunately it rained during our tour but it was still a great time. The tour also provides snacks like muffins and cookies along with hot coco and starbucks coffee to keep your stomachs happy. 3) Try some of Chicago's famous eateries for lunch, which are chicago style hot dog, deep dish, and italian beef sandwich. The first day we hit Mr. Beef, was awesome. Highly recommend it. The next day we hit Giordono's and watch some NFL football. Wasn't bad. The last day we hit this hot dog spot next to Pippin's (thanks for the suggestion Russell). Was very tasty. 4) If you want to get away from downtown for dinner and experience some good authentic Italian, I would highly recommend checking out Lincoln Park/Lake View area. It's probably about 2-3 miles north of the hotel. We went to Riccardo Trattoria and must say it was probably the best Italian we've had since we visited Rome. They have a 3 course menu for $33/person and the portions are very filling and full of great flavors. You won't be dissapointed. Be sure to make reservations. 5) If your a baseball fan, take the metro (L) to wrigley field. The cubs were out of town when we were there but they were offering a tour of the stadium/locker rooms for $25 a person for an hour tour. Would have done it but the wifey wasn't big on the idea so we hit a bar next door to watch the Steelers/Bears game. Fun experience. We'll definitely be back again. Probalby with the kids next time. There are so many awesome museums and other things for the kids to do there that we did not get to explore. Beautiful city and the beach there was very pretty and clean. Great place for a morning/afternoon run. Was within walking distance from the shopping on N. Michigan Avn.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Aled_Vic
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days in Chicago with lots of walking which made the Wyndham a superb location. You're one block off the Magnificent mile with great shops. You're also not far from Lake shore drive, the beach, Chicago zoo and also the trendier part of town where there are some tasty and great value restaurants. The room was light and clean and the bed was big. However the communal carpets were a bit worn and dirty. Some of the little things like not having a shower cap in the room was what bothered me the most.

Reviews.Title: “Wyndham Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: Mike P
Reviews.Content: My first booking with Bing.com/travel and my first stay at the Wyndham Downtown Chicago. While the lobby and common areas were nice...the floor levels and rooms were dirty and nasty. The carpets in the hallways and rooms were absolutely discusting and the furnishings were outdated and worn. Houskeeping was actually still cleaning rooms after 10:00pm and not even trying to be quiet. When I brought it to the attention of the front desk they stated "the rooms still had to be cleaned, no matter how late it was." Had I had tried the Wyndham by O'Hare a few years ago and had sworn that I would never stay at a Wyndham again. That one is now closed and this one should be.....Shame on them for taking people's money and providing this kind of service to hard working people who deserve better! The Capital Grill downstairs should divorce themself's of this hotel completely! Good bye forever Wyndham and possibly Bing Travel, if they can't weed out the bad one's. If Bing can't short them out....I certainly can....

Reviews.Title: “Great Suite Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Paul C
Reviews.Content: On Sept 9, my extended family booked 4 rooms for 3 nights in Chicago for a wedding downtown. We flew into Chicago Midway airport and took the train into downtown - $2.50 each. You have to change trains once your are downtown and then it was about 5 blocks to the hotel. I'd only recommend this if you are traveling light and have some time on your hands. The cab ride would have been around $30 - $35 with tip. Travelzoo had a 1/2 off rate on a regular room for $130 and the suite for $140 per night. We opted for the suite and it was a real deal. The room was huge. I think they made the suite out of 2 standard rooms. The suite had a king bedroom and another equally sized sitting room with sofa, desk chairs, etc. The hotel is centrally located and there are a lot of places to eat nearby. The only negative aspect with the hotel was the reservations desk. One of our family had extended their reservations a day and it was a real nightmare getting it straightened out. Overall, though, if you are staying in downtown Chicago, I would recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful concierge staff”
Reviews.Author: fshop
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights during the first week in September. Our room was comfortable and very clean and on the 16th floor. The location is fabulous, a block off Michigan Avenue, in walking distance of many theaters and other attractions. Good restaurants for breakfast a step or two away. The concierge staff at the hotel was outstanding in helping us with bus passes, recommendations for restaurants, and theatre and attraction tickets. Would definitely stay there again. Really loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Wyndham Chicago great location”
Reviews.Author: JoJo114
Reviews.Content: This hotel is only one block away from Michigan Ave. Great location!! We walked to the beach and Navy Pier. The room was very clean. Very helpful staff at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Three Times WAS NOT A Charm. :(”
Reviews.Author: Nichol N
Reviews.Content: My husband & I have stayed at this Wyndham twice before in the past several years with one of our three daughters to have each of them experience American Girl Place, individually. The previous two visits were very pleasant. The staff was always great & seemed to go out of their way for us, the rooms seemed a bit tired when we were here 2 years ago, but not too bad. Plus, the great service made up for it. However, this time I called a month prior to our trip & asked if they by chance they were renovating & if so, if there was any way we could stay in a renovated room. The person at the desk transferred me to a manager, & I left message for a manager (unfortunately I cannot remember her name) asking the same questions. No one ever bothered to return my call. That should have been my first warning. When we got to hotel, the staff was pleasant, but our room was very tired. The carpet was filthy & the light fixture in the entrance was so outdated & dirty. It was a dingy cream fabric light that fanned into half a circle. It looked like it was falling apart & was stained. The last night of our stay, we were upgraded to a suite by Kartika (manager), for some of our troubles, so the extra space was definitely nice. Kartika was the friendliest person we dealt with by far, she was great! The sofa in the suite was so stained, we were afraid to sit on it. Since we took this trip to treat our youngest daughter to American Girl Place, we purchased the AG doll hair styling package with our reservation. This package included a doll bed, hair products for the AG doll, & it was supposed to include a DVD with hair styling tips for the doll. Also, the package included an AG channel. What the package failed to tell us was that no one would have any idea what hair styling DVD we were referring to. Also, the "channel" was just the Kit Kittredge movie playing over & over. The package, at the time (2 weeks ago), did not say that the movie looped again & again, but it does now. It did not at the time, we checked while there & shared with the staff. At the time the website even said the DVD was one to take home. It no longer does say it's to take home, but I bet the staff still doesn't know what DVD the website is referring to. Glad the website at least now says the movie is looped & the DVD doesn't say it's to take home for the sake of those staying there from here out. Not major things to some, but still irritating & disappointing. Also, the first two times we stayed at WC, the staff had the AG bed & everything set up so nicely in our room for our daughter. Such a sweet treat for our daughters. This time, they did not. In fact, when we got up to our room, we had to call down to the desk to ask where our AG bed was. They brought it up, but I was disappointed that the extra details we once loved, no longer existed at WC. One day, our beds were never even completely made. We got back to our room late & didn't even bother calling down to let the desk know about our unmade beds because we were tired. We were greatly disappointed that this hotel we once loved just didn't seem to care about the little details that matter greatly or about the major details that make one sleep better at night (dingy carpets, etc). When we got home we found out that WC overcharged us. My husband called & spoke to Kartika (since she was great with us) & she took care of it, but this was just another let down from WC. No one from the staff was ever rude & the rooms were cleaned the best they could be given the situation, but like I said, the staff (besides Kartika) just didn't seem to go the extra mile & the rooms need a major renovation or at least new furniture, carpet & fresh paint. Guess three times wasn't a charm for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel but tired rooms”
Reviews.Author: ellie1983
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a fab lobby, comfy bar area, good gym and super helpful staff. The location is spot on, right off Magnificent Mile and close to Gino's East and a great breakfast place across the street. Although the rooms are clean and spacious,, the only fault I could find would be that they are a little tired - curtains, carpets, etc. The pay-per-day wi-fi is a bit annoying too. Overall though, a pretty good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in Need of a Remodel!”
Reviews.Author: TravelinLeather
Reviews.Content: I am staying at the hotel and writing this review as I'm sitting in my guest room. It's a suite (King Suite B as listed on the hotel website). When I check into a suite I expect at least a touch of luxury but the only thing I can say that is positive about the guest room is that it's LARGE. The living room area has some outdated (and ripped) furniture that looks like it was just thrown in to eat up some of the space. (I posted pictures). It's a large open space that I really dont want to spend any time in and doesn't feel relaxing. The bathroom is larger with HUGE counter space which is nice but that's the only plus there. In a suite I would expect a nice closet and probably one that is even larger than a standard guest room. Well, the closet here is TINY - less than 2 feet across (picture posted). There a 2 TVs in the room but both old tube TVs. The carpet throughout the hotel is well worn. The only reason I didn't rate this lower is becuase all of the staff I have met from front desk to housekeeping, concierge, banquet staff, and front desk have been professional, helpful and friendly. It's nice that this hotel is 1 block from Michigan Ave and the shopping but there are cheaper options that are probably more comfortable. The Marriott up the street or Hilton Garden Inn would be less expensive and the room would be more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fabulous concierges!”
Reviews.Author: HeidiWD
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the beautiful city of Chicago for a long weekend for business. The Wyndham was a terrific location--halfway between the lakefront and Michigan avenue. The room was clean and comfortable--not fancy, but adequate. The exercise area was spacious including a clean, well-maintained pool as well as a steam room and sauna! But the highlight was the helpful, concierge department. Denise and Kaitlyn made great recommendations (honest ones, too), made reservations, remembered our names with even the first brief encounter, and were both fun and funny! I looked forward to passing their desk on the way out of the hotel! I have never had such good concierge help outside of Europe!! They were wonderfully well-informed. I would stay at the Wyndham again just for them!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: joannatodd
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Wyndham for 3 nights over Labour Day weekend. Check-in was great, the staff was very friendly and accomodating. They went out of their way to help celebrate our daughter's birthday by delivering a piece of cake to our room the morning of. We stayed in a double bed room, which was very comfortable, clean and enough room for two adults, a three year old and a baby. The hotel has a small but very nice pool with a hot tub next to it. We did not eat at the restaurant but the food looked and smelled good. They have a breakfast buffet on the weekend. The hotel was a bit run-down in spots but that was really it. Overall, it was clean, the staff were very friendly and it was a nice place to stay while visiting Chicago. The location is fantastic, one block over from the Magnificent Mile and a 15 minute walk from Navy Pier. It is also near to a lot of restaurants. In the room, there is a coffee maker, a cooler (not a real fridge but kept everything cold enough including milk and baby food), and bath products from Bath & Body. Our only complaint was that there was no parking at the hotel and they charged $52 (!!!!) a night for valet parking. You could self-park (which is what we did) if you could find parking on your own for cheaper. We parked a few blocks down for $35 a night. Apparently there is no parking in the downtown core, so I guess we were lucky to find overnight parking at a lower rate!

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as some other reviews claim.”
Reviews.Author: bryanunknown
Reviews.Content: I had mixed feelings about our stay after reading reviews on this site and tripadvisor, but this is what i came away with... Though not the most amazing hotel in Chicago, by far, the Wyndham Chicago was still a great stay for me and my wife. If you make under 80k a year and are just in Chicago to enjoy yourself, and have some fun, it will probably be just fine. If you make over 120k a year or have a trust fund, drive something like an Audi or a Porsche, and are looking to show off to your family and friends, you might want to stay somewhere else. Yes, there are some stains in the hallways, the wi-fi (plus other additional add-ons after what you've already paid) is kind of a joke, there are SOME/A FEW minor things that could use updating/replacing, and they are still working with 25' tube televisions. But overall, we were more than happy with our stay. The price was not too bad, the room was clean, current/updated, represented well by the pictures we saw online, (what we saw was what we got) the bed was very comfortable, the hotel was close to alot of the main commercial business, the view was nice, (16th floor) and the staff, though not exactly singing and dancing for us, were perfectly fine, and not rude. I guess it just depends on what degree of spoil you want/have when it comes to hotels and accommodations or what you are accustomed to. BTW- At that height, the ambulance sirens (due to a hospital across the street) were still a little loud and obvious but were not a bother to us. Its just seemed like part of life in the big city. No problems sleeping. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - nice property!”
Reviews.Author: LuckyLady5050
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Wyndham in Chicago for a family wedding for three nights in July 2011. We had two adjoining rooms for 3 kids (6, 3, and 3 mths) and 4 adults. It was perfect! The beds are very comfortable. The crib fit in the space very well. The bathrooms are a good size. The location to restaurants, coffee shops, breakfasts locations, pubs, and shopping is excellent. We checked in early thanks to staff. Our kids stayed in a suite for a few hours while we attended the wedding reception. The pool was small but adequate. The in-room refrigerators fit the leftover Gino's East deep dish pizza -- excellent hot and cold. The in-house restaurant seemed a bit formal with three kids so we ate out for breakfast. Nice walk to the Lake, Navy Pier, and Museum of Contemporary Art.

Reviews.Title: “It is truly not a 5 star Hotel 2 1/2 at best”
Reviews.Author: Trisha856
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly. Not enough help at check in lobby to assist with check in. The lobby and rooms were clean. But the hotel rooms need to be renovated. Our room furniture was worn, sofa has a 12 inch cut on the arm. The rooms has fat boy tube televisions. Come on this is suppose to be a five star no flat screens tvs. The entry to all floor to the elevatore were filty and needed cleaning and so did the inlay carpet in the lobby was worn out and dirty and need replacing also. What a way to make an impression. Great location, stayed 5 days. would not pay that amount of money again for a 2 1/2 star hotel. Trump Tower is a 5 star hotel in everyway.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is really close to Michigan Ave....”
Reviews.Author: Cowpiggymoo
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Wyndham Hotel Chicago for 4 nights. We chose this hotel for the location. It is literally steps away from Michigan Ave, "The Magnificent Mile". The Hotel is within walking distance to many good restaurants. I recommend The Weber Grill and also Texas De Brazil (for meat lovers). The Hotel staff is very polite and courteous, make sure you go to see Denise Henry at the concierge desk! She is AWESOME! Her suggestions really helped plan out our daily itinerary for some Chicago Fun! Thanks Denise! I also recommend that (if weather permits) take a water taxi. The view of the city is fantastic and there is less congestion of traffic on the water. The only 2 negative comments about the Wyndham is that their Valet parking fee is really expensive, $52 per night. There is no self park option. The other negative comment is that there is no in room safe to store valuables, passports etc...

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: TN-Frank
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night while in Chicago for a White Sox game. The room was clean. The front desk staff were very friendly and allowed us to check-in before 3pm. This hotel is located very close to the Mag Mile - lots of shopping. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located just off the Magnificent Mile”
Reviews.Author: deekay744
Reviews.Content: As the title says, the location of the hotel just off the Magnificent Mile is a great plus point. It has a 7-eleven nearby, the Corner Bakery just across the road, and restaurants everywhere! Front desk and concierge are extremely friendly and helpful. I stay at this hotel about once every three months and some of the staff seem to already recognize me. The hotel room has a really comfortable bed. However, the television could be newer. It's still an old CRT television. Also, the plumbing could be redone. Kind of noisy. The temperature control has a nice feature of telling you the outside temperature. Very useful especially during winter. Also, since the hotel is just opposite a hospital, you are bound to be woken up in the middle of the night by the sound of sirens. Seriously, why do ambulance drivers keep the sirens and horns all the way to the entrance of the hospital? The gym is very well equipped. Sauna is fantastic. Swimming pool is a bit small but good enough if it's not overrun by kids. Did not try out the eateries because Chicago has hundreds of restaurants. All in all, it's a pretty good hotel mainly due to its comfy beds and its good location.

Reviews.Title: “very good location for families”
Reviews.Author: Nmbt211
Reviews.Content: Spacious & the very good location is pros The Hospital nearby & the sirens is a cons! Very helpful staff & clean. would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Racso1166
Reviews.Content: We just recently stayed at this hotel. The location is great. Not on Michigan ave but very close ( 1 block ) to all the stores ,shops and restaurants. You can here ambulances drive by if you are in the lower floors.The room itself was nothing out of the ordinary but it was clean and it did not smell. The bathroom is nothing out of the ordinary either but clean.The hotel should clean up the carpeting . It is stained badly in many areas. Customer service,baggage and valet were fine. No complaints. One big disappointment was that the hotel did not give the Allstate Insurance Auto Club discount as was mentioned by Hotels.com. They stated " Show your Auto Club Card at the desk and receive $20. 00 off the rate " NOT !! It didn't happen. Also we were not happy about no free Wi Fi.If you want Wi Fi it comes at a $10.95 per day cost ! Come on ! We've stayed at Days Inns and Comfort Inns with free Wi Fi. Overall the room was sufficient for a decent stay.

Reviews.Title: “This is a decent hotel in a great location. I was able to walk to most places in the city from their downtown location.”
Reviews.Author: worldvacation123
Reviews.Content: the hotel is conveniently located and most places in the city are walkable from there. The front desk staff was very efficient. They were able to handle any concerns and request promptly. I thought they could be more upbeat and smile a little more however. I don't know if it's just me but some of the staff at this hotel seem to have prying eyes. Particularly, in the concierge area. One women who seems to work during the day kept looking at me while I was talking to the other concierge clerk. I avoided eye contact with her as much as possible. She just came across as rather nosy. The other concierge who was helping me was very helpful nevertheless and he gave me some helpful insights about the city, which I appreciated as it was my first time visiting Chicago. However one day I tried to reach him over the phone a couple of times but he was never available. That same woman working with him was the one who always answered the phone. I wished she had offered to have him call me back. Another issue I had with the concierge staff is that I was misinformed by the staff working the evening shift. I wanted to go visit the Buckingham Fountain while the water was spurting. He told me this goes on until 11:30pm but that's only on the weekends. It was a Tuesday and that all ends at 10pm and ended up going there around 11pm. A couple other minor issues I had is that one of the bell man hit on me as I was getting out of the elevator and one gentleman working in the pool area made sure he took a quick peek at me as I was getting out of the water. Otherwise everything was fine. The pool was the perfect size as I am 5'3 and I don't swim. The steam room, sauna and whirlpool were enjoyable. The hotel is clean overall, but the the chairs in the lower lobby look tacky and old. that for the 2 couches on the second level as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Whitemancantjump
Reviews.Content: Great hotel - great room size. Concierge was very helpful. Overall wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: lqdenver
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wyndham for a couple of nights in late August. The room was nicely appointed, though not large. The staff were all very helpful and nice, the Concierge especially so. The location is good if like me you like to walk around a city to see it; all of the downtow/loop sights were within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Blah”
Reviews.Author: jude479
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on a whim. We thought it would be fun to sneak away during the week and stay downtown. So without any expectations and going where ever Hotwire placed us-- we ended up here. Blah blah blah. First the front desk is lacking. We waited in a very long line while one person chit chatted with a guest, and the other looked up only to say she will be with us in a moment. 10 moments later-- and we were still waiting. When we got to the desk she was chewing gum with her mouth open and roughly asking what our last name was. She also repeatedly kept answering questions with "Yeah"-- 4 star hotel? The lobby is dirty-- the carpets are a mess. Once in the room we called down to the concierge to ask about a service in the hotel-- no answer. Called the front desk-- no answer. Our room was clean and that was a relief. But the amenities in the room are so antiquated. A cd alarm clock? A hair dryer my mom had when I was 14 stuck to the wall. An old Panasonic tv. No internet cables to plug into? I was surprised. Given the expense and location -- I expected something more updated. Then we moved to the pool-- TINY. Very small. And at 10:30pm it was filled with children. With no life guard on duty they dove, splashed, and generally annoyed everyone else there. All this is to say-- if you enjoy getting your money's worth-- don't stay here. If you are looking for a clean bed and bathroom and don't care about the lobby, service, or pool-- then this place is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Carpets are flithy.”
Reviews.Author: pieLansing
Reviews.Content: The carpets near the elevators are disgusting. Huge dark stains. Going down the hallways are also stained. We had a big stain in our room as well. This is a four star hotel, why not clean or replace the horrible carpet. Internet is $10.95 a day. Seriously?! Internet now a days is free in most hotels. On the positive side, the staff were friendly. I would not stay here again, I prefer clean hotels.

Reviews.Title: “nice enough”
Reviews.Author: Champurbresident
Reviews.Content: I spent one night in a room with a king bed at this hotel. The room was spacious and clean. The staff were professional. Generally it was a typical hotel experience in Chicago for me. Nothing out of the ordinary, either overly positive or negative. The only thing that really bothered me, hoewver, was the stains on the carpet on the hallway outside my door (on the 9th floor). It looked as if a dog had peed in several spots (I must have counted at least ten) or multiple cups of coffee had been spilled over time. Cant they just clean this mess? But the room itself was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay there again”
Reviews.Author: RandD S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at this hotel and we were impressed. Our stay was for five days. As other reviewers stated, you will hear sirens. They seemed worse on the weekend. The room was fine. There was a stain on the carpet, which kind of bugged me. But, it was otherwise clean. The best things about this hotel - the staff are very helpful (all interactions were fantastic) and the location. Aside from being next to a hospital, the location is fabulous. It's very close to great shopping and bus lines that can get you anywhere. We took a taxi from the airport and it cost us $43 including tip. After that, we just walked or took a bus everywhere, which was really simple to do. This hotel has a nice workout room as well. If we go to Chicago again for a vacation, this is where we will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average accomodations...”
Reviews.Author: Tfd206
Reviews.Content: First of all, I called four days before arrival to confirm our reservation and request a crib for our room for our infant son. I was bounced backed to the hotel operator 4 times because no one answered the extention she kept transfering me to. I finally told the operator that this was getting ridiculous. She relented and confirmed our reservation herself and noted the request for a crib. Upon check-in the front desk was pleasant and said that the crib was noted and should be in the room. It wasn't, but after a call to the front desk one was delivered to our room shortly after. The room was just ok as there were a couple of large stains on the carpet. My wife said one of the stains on carpet next to the bed looked like blood but to me it looked like redpop or kool aid had been spilled. The beds were semi comfortable but bed skirts appeared to be dirty or stained. The bathroom was nice and big but had mildew growing where the tile met the tub. Housekeeping didn't make our room up until after 4:00 one day. We left our room at 9:30am went out shoppping and sight-seeing came back at 4:00 and our room hadn't been made up. Housekeeping finally showed up and we left to the lobby so our room could be made up. Not happy as we were tired and the baby was sleeping. If you are a light sleeper this hotel is not for you. The hotel across from Northwestern U Hospital and you will hear sirens all night and day.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip! Hotel has excelent location in Chicago! I recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Diani_Villar
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of its location. Wyndham is perfectly located to Michigan Avenue and other sights of the city. Although I have read comments about the street noise coming from a hospital near the hotel, I had no trouble sleeping. Everything went smoothly on my stay. I recommend! I would just make a suggestion to the hotel, which was installed in-room safes.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, One Block from Michigan Avenue, Shopping Galore”
Reviews.Author: MyMeShall
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to this hotel and it definitely won't be my last. Check in was fast, friendly and very accommodating. I requested and received a room on the 17th floor with a great view! The hotel also granted my request for a late check out which is always a plus. The bed was incredible soft yet firm. I woke rested, energized and ready to take on the magnificent mile! McDonalds on the next block made Huge ice cream cones! The only downfall with this hotel like other hotels in that location was the outrageous price for overnight valet parking $52.00!! This hotel was slightly higher then competitors $48.00 and $50.00. I could have filled my vehicle with gas for that amount.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Kitty-2004
Reviews.Content: This was a good hotel for a mini family trip. Just 2 nights but had a junior suite which was a great price from travel zoo. Hotel staff was quick and did take the tip and asked for the side of the hotel not facing the hospital. Good advice as the sirens ran day and night. Russel the coneige could not have been more helpful and was a big hit with the granddaughter as he gave her a coupon for an ice cream sunday in the hotel dinning area.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and nice but very noisy and having to go to 2nd floor for elevators wears thin”
Reviews.Author: Marie500
Reviews.Content: Room was spotless and bed was very comfortable. Service nice. Adjoining room doors made it very noisy in that you could hear person on phone in other room. We were in the x35 line and it faces the ambulance route where there was at least one per hour , sirens blasting. I grew up in NYC so take this from where it came. We all remarked that Manhattan is quieter from a siren perspective. Maybe other side is quieter. Also, you have to take elevators or stairs to second floor to get elevator to room. Not a big deal for us but I point this out to anyone not as mobile. Might look elsewhere next time

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room, but NOISY”
Reviews.Author: Travelprofessor_10
Reviews.Content: The Wyndham is reasonably priced, just north of the Loop, and in the center of the Magnificent Mile shopping distriect. We found outstanding restaurants just steps from the door, as well as easy access to bike rentals, the El, and a quick walk to Millennium park. The room was spacious and bright with good in-room amenities, including a fridge in which to store leftovers. BUT beware - this hotel is directly across the street from the Northwestern University Hospital. From 3pm to 3am and again starting at 6 am, the ambulances were almost non-stop. If you go, be sure to get a room on the nbn-hospital side of the hotel.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Alphen aan den Rijn, The Netherlands
Reviews.Title: “How does it excist”
Reviews.Author: mountainst
Reviews.Content: I never knew that a 5 star hotel downtown a amjor city in the USA can be so badly maintained and unfriendly.
