WiFi has to be paid for, but in over 50% of the hotel it does not work. the conciÃ«rge it obliged to help out free in the business center with little or no result Tap of the bath was broken, telefoons hang loose from the walls, the carpet in the whole hotel is dirty, so bad that one believes to be in a slump. Terrible. Never Ã  Wyndham again.

Reviews.Title: “BE CAREFUL IF YOU BOOK THRU HOTELS.COM OR EXPEDIA”
Reviews.Author: Marcus678
Reviews.Content: I prepaid a three night stay in May thru hotels.com. When I showed up at 6pm in July for to check in, they pleasantly told me that they didn't have a room for me. While I was there, 2 other hotels.com customers and 1 Expedia customer were also turned away. With Chicago in peak season, it is pretty obvious they kept selling rooms at a much better rate than what we were paying, so we became expendable. They didn't even have the courtesy to put thru a full credit. I had to go back to hotels.com for that. They stuck me in a very old Holiday Inn (which they probably have an interest in) 6 blocks from the Michigan Ave. They provided no compensation for my inconvenience, just cab fare.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Excellent service especially the concierge”
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about service to its customers. I stayed with my daughter for one night. It was a pleasure trip basically to shop and walk the Magnificent Mile. Michigan Avenue is one block away. The location is excellent for shopping, dining, night life. It's close to a hospital but the sirens were not annoying one bit. I would definitely stay here again. Also, they have a great group of staff working the concierge who go above and beyond in helping you with anything you need and answering any questions you have about the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: nasdaqnole
Reviews.Content: Greetings from Florida. We spent 3 nights at the Wyndham (July 18-21) while traveling to Chicago for a family wedding. The location of this hotel could not be any better. FANTASTIC! Stategically located smack in the middle of Lincoln Park, Navy Peir, and Millenium Park and a stones throw from Michigan Ave/Magnificent Mile. Additionally, the comfort level offered at this hotel is very good. House keeping was very efficient and replaced hotel supplied toiletries every day. The room was very comfortable with a king-size bed, 6 pillows, a desk, chase lounge, fridge, and a city view from the 17th floor (lake views are available). The hotel offers a well appointed workout room, indoor pool, hot tub, dry sauna and steam room. Buffet breakfast in the hotel restaurant was something like $18, though it offered an abundance of choices. The location of this property also offers a Dunkin Donuts next door, Corner Bakery Cafe across the street and a Geno's East Pizzeria 1 block away. A multitude of restaurants and bars are within a 5 minute walk of the hotel lobby. Also, parking was billed to the room at $25 per night which may have been a discount as the quoted price by valet was $42. An excellent experience overall, and I would DEFINATELY stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff friendly, hotel itself? - juries out!!”
Reviews.Author: taggsSydney
Reviews.Content: First, the pluses - great location with easy walk to Magnificent Mile and restaurants. Staff were friendly and helpful. Airline check-in facility is poor but staff were willing to help on their computer and also print out boarding passes. Downside - couldn't sleep first night due to what sounded like a jackhammer in the bathroom - something wrong with the plumbing. Maintenance came in around midnight but couldn't rectify the problem. Next day the hotel arranged to move rooms and floors, unfortunately, new room on the 11th floor couldn't get wi-fi internet for over 24 hours. Also the room wasn't as good as the original on the 17th floor, however, at least I were able to get a good night's sleep for the rest of my stay. Had a lovely meal at Rosebud on Rush within walking distance of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, good location.”
Reviews.Author: acdavis
Reviews.Content: We only spent one night here, but the room was clean and comfortable and seemed to be a bit larger than other hotel rooms we have stayed in when we have visited Chicago. The staff was friendly and we didn't have any problems other than the Wi-Fi being really slow. If you are there on business and need fast internet, that might be a problem for you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location, overall great value”
Reviews.Author: peterhill3505
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple days on a summer getaway. We got a great pre-pay rate and especially given the cost, I think this hotel was an exceptional value. The location is AWESOME. Just a couple blocks off the Magnificent Mile, which we enjoyed because it was convenient to everything but secluded from the crowds. The room was modern, very clean and comfortable. We were pleased that the hotel has a very nice pool, which is not necesarily the norm in downtown. Facilities are pleasant (even luxurious) and the service was mostly average to very good. There were a few minor annoyances during our stay. We had to move from our first room because there was no a/c in the middle of summer (as we didn't think their offer of a fan would be very comfortable). The maintenance tech was very friendly and offered to have our luggage moved, but I was a little disappointed there was no apology from the front desk given it was a fairly significant inconvenience. Also there was a really annoying motion detector that clicked loudly every time we moved...I assume this is a security feature but we ended up putting a piece of paper over it :-) Overall, I'd certainly stay again if I were in Chicago...as long as it was the same price or less expensive than other 3-star options.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: MN-Mom-Mpls
Reviews.Content: The lobby left much to be desired, it really didn't provide much of a gathering/meeting place. Doorman on first floor, concierge and front desk on second floor. It did have a great location and friendly staff. Of course being in downtown Chicago, the room was quite noisey. But the beds were comfortable and the rooms were very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Best concierges EVER”
Reviews.Author: labyak
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the first time for two nights (7/9-7/11) with my fiance for a romantic weekend in the city. Although the hotel's facilities were a bit outdated in a few ways (no flat-screened TVs), it more than made up for it by its top quality service. Our trip would not have been the same without the personal attention lavished upon us by the two concierges, Kaitlyn and Russell. Not only did they give us easy-to-follow directions to a popular brunch location (Perennial) that we were interested in, Kaitlyn called ahead to the restaurant for us and got gave us a reservation. She even gave us a restaurant gift card from her own personal stash. Later, after we've left, Russell ran THREE BLOCKS to our bus stop because he wanted to make sure that we knew the right stop to get off at. This level of service and attention to detail was completely unexpected, and they are the reason why I would stay at Wyndham again. If you are hoping to tour the city and especially if this is your first time in Chicago, you would be well served to stay and Wyndham and visit its concierge desk.

Reviews.Title: “Average Amenities; Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: jenni33
Reviews.Content: My husband, 13 month old daughter, and I stayed here in June 2011. We were taking a little getaway for our 5 year anniversary. We had never stayed in a Wyndham Hotel but assumed it was comparable to a Hilton. As far as amenities go, yes. Service was a different story. Upon arrival at valet, there was a huge line. Probably 10 cars waiting to be parked, doubled stacked along the street. No one approached us to ask if we were checking in. We unloaded our own car entirely, along with our daughter in my arms and stood there looking for someone to help us. Finally we saw a valet who came and gave us a luggage claim ticket and ushered us off. Upon walking in the doors, it was very unclear where to go, but you must get on the elevator and go up a level to check in. The check in attendant was less than friendly. No smiles, no "enjoy your stay," nothing warm or welcoming. We went to our room and waited for our luggage. We waited and waited and waited. Finally we called the front desk - which transferred us to valet - valet claimed they had no luggage waiting to be delivered. They asked for our claim ticket number - which we gave to them. They found our luggage and brought it right up to us. Freddy - from valet who delivered our luggage - was really the only friendly and helpful employee at the hotel. Total time waiting for our luggage was around an hour and a half. We consulted concierge a few times. Once for a dinner recommendation, somewhere we could take our 13 month old, and were given unuseful suggestions. Small, overcrowded restaurants, certainly not baby friendly. The second time was to ask where we could purchase a cup of milk for our daughter at bedtime. The concierge attendant answered "the bar" and then walked away. I felt as though I was keeping her from something more important. As for the amenities...the room was clean, the bathroom was quite large and the beds were comfortable. The walls were thin and I often worried that our crying baby might disturb other guests. We plan to visit Chicago again soon, but we will be staying in a different hotel. Honestly, the poor service has turned us off from staying in other Wyndhams in the future. I hope this review helps other families.

Reviews.Title: “It was a nice older hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: DCTravelBunny
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice but a bit older. The staff was very friendly. The bar and roomservice menu leave a lot to desire. I ordered a club sandwich and there was no honey mustard. ( I know it's trivial, but it's my favorite!) The young lady behind the bar was a great bartender, if you were a male. My mother and I had to consistently interrupt her conversations with the young navy recruits that were there for the weekend. There were no flat screens and you do have to pay $11.00 for internet. The bathroom was very clean as was the room. The great thing about this hotel is t's location. We were within walking distance (1 block) from Ferragamo! yay! There were very many stores that I loved that were located nearby. So if you are into shopping, this is a great place to be. Overall I had a good stay at the Wyndham.

Reviews.Title: “AVERAGE”
Reviews.Author: freakstar
Reviews.Content: Ok, first the positives: nice room, big bathroom, great central location. Negatives: 1. The shower in the bathroom must be about 5 foot from the base of the bath meaning that the average person would have to crouch to have a decent shower (also the water pressure was poor). 2. The pillows. I presently have a very sore neck/upper back. You are provided with plenty of pillows on the bed. However they are either exteremly soft (even piling 3 on top of each other the head touches the mattress) or large and very hard. I requested for something inbetween however, apparently only these two types are available...poor show. 3. Timing of room being cleaned. Each day i would leave at 9/10 am and returning at 4 (ready to crash after a hectic day) my room was never made up. On the plus, it allowed me to retreat to the bar for a drink! The maids were exteremly nice. However, water was never replenished. 4. MiniBar. Why offer a fridge and nothing in it? If I want a Coke, should I really have to call room service (including SC and delivery fee)? Often room service did not answer (despite calling separately over 30 minutes). Eventually I needed to call the front desk with my order. 5. Room service - food only available until 10pm. Also, there was no dining menu in my room. When I had this sent up, it was very very limited. Additionally, I had a rather strange guy (with pony tail) that came with my order. Not sure if he is suited to room service as I felt rather uncomfortable (mentioning service charges and looking strangely at me when I know full well it is included with the bill), so much so that I didnt order again. 6. Noise - not much the hotel can do about being next to the Emergncy Department however, the sirens are very loud. 7. Information in the room. Very limited details of pool etc. 8. Access. The hotel really should have its reception on the Ground floor of hotel with direct access to all floors. Using 2 lifts is a hassle. 9. Staff. Really quite impersonable. In 5 days I had not one welcome from the door staff despite me attempting to smile and make eye contact. Also, an extremelly disappointing member at reception when I needed a new room key (as the one I had didnt work). She appeared to be of some authority with a smarter suit and holding radio etc. A please, thank you or smile costs nothing. 10. Internet. In this day and age, it should be complimentary. All in all, you can tell that this is a chain hotel with little character. As I mentioned previously, as smile costs nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location / Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: theconners
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel back in 2010 and we loved it. It's a little pricey but you truly get what you pay for here. The check in was seamless, concierge was awesome. I had arranged to have some flowers in the room at check in for my wife and she loved them. They were beautifully arranged and it was easy to set up thanks to the concierge. The room was very nice and the bed was comfortable. We will definitely be back soon!!! Go White Sox!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed and won't return”
Reviews.Author: littleangie617
Reviews.Content: Disappointed with stay at Wyndham! This hotel didn't feel like a 4 star hotel. Charged 0.35 per minute to use internet in business center. Been to less expensive hotels and received free internet. Also, my mother is a diabetic, requested refrigerator for room to store insulin, was charged $15.00. Felt this hotel nickle and dimed customers as much as they could, seemed greedy. Pool also very small to be a 4 star hotel. Rooms small and outdated

Reviews.Title: “Strange Stay”
Reviews.Author: pawge756
Reviews.Content: Okay - the hotel is nice, but the strangest things happened. In the middle of the night, I got up to go to the bathroom, and discovered the toilet seat was up (I am a woman and never put the toilet seat up). Didn't think too much about this, but found it odd. The next morning, upon returning from the fitness center, I again went into the bathroom and this time, the towels (previously hanging neatly on the rack) were on the floor. Very strange. I can't explain this. Anyone else ever have this happen?

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect to get any sleep with ambulance runs to next door hospital”
Reviews.Author: JohnLouisv
Reviews.Content: Ok place, but could use some updating. However, the biggest problem is it is right next door to a very busy hospital that over our Saturday night stay had ambulance runs throughout the night, at least 15. The room windows are not soundproof, therefore, you hear every one like they are passing right next to you, which they are.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place in central location”
Reviews.Author: PeripateticTwo
Reviews.Content: High level views were impressive. Breakfast pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Could use a bit of updating.”
Reviews.Author: Jazzbo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wyndham June 7-11 for a family vacation. The room and bathroom were decent-sized for a Chicago hotel, and the beds were very comfy. The concierge were always BEYOND helpful, and they really helped make our trip all it could be. My one negative would be that the room could use some updating. It was a bit tired looking, and the TV really needed to be updated. It was a small,old-style TV, with a slightly fuzzy picture; most hotels in this price range have gone to flat screens, and that would be a very nice update. I booked the hotel through Expedia, on a deal I found through Travel Zoo. I prepaid with a rate that was about $740 for the entire stay. The price was right, and the location was just a block or two away from the fabulous shopping on the Magnificent Mile.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not cheap, not expensive either”
Reviews.Author: yellowplum
Reviews.Content: Overall very good. Great location. Right across from the northwestern memorial hospital so the occasional ambulance siren can be a problem to some people. The rooms are a bit old but very well kept and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Love.Love.Love!”
Reviews.Author: Martini_Momma1
Reviews.Content: The staff was so nice and helpful. The room was beautiful. I've told a million people about the accommodations. Thank you so much! I love you!...ox..Joanie Boise Idaho

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Stellar424
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful and the staff was very helpful. The beds were extremely comfortable and the bathroom was very nice. The room itself was spacious. The rooms and bathrooms seemed to be newly updated. We had received a deal on Travelzoo that got us free breakfast. The breakfast was good, but I would not ever pay the full price for it. The hotel was within walking distance to Michigan Ave. and all the shops there. There were also several restaurants close by.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better”
Reviews.Author: Shawn215
Reviews.Content: This place was in a great location, right near Michigan avenue. Check in was at 4 pm, which is beyond me. We only had to wait 10 minutes to get our room right around noon. The room itself was nice, but they didn't have a flat screen or an ipod dock. Most hotels these days have this. The bathroom was HUGE, but the sitting area was "old lady like". this place needs an update. There are plenty of better alternatives in this city. On a positive note, the concierge was more than helpful in helping us find things to do on a rainy day

Reviews.Title: “Its good but needs investments to improve”
Reviews.Author: handofgod7
Reviews.Content: Well to start with, the room was spacious and the bathroom was nice too.Needs an upgrade if they need to compete with other hotel chains.29 inch tv (which should be changed to a flat screen in coming years considering if they are claiming to be a 4 star hotel) with few channels (No HBO).Its located nicely near Michigan ave across Marriott and Red roof hotel. Dunkin Donut, Starbucks, 7 eleven, subway is in 1 min walking distance. Safe neighborhood!! The consignee was very good especially a guy named Russell. I know he was tired of people asking so many questions but he was very polite and very helpful.One of my biggest problem was the internet, the At&t connection sucks...I was advised to get a bridge but nothing worked.I stayed 2 days without internet.I am a Wyndham rewards card holder, and internet was supposed to be free for me when the internet didn't work...I was asked to pay 11$/day to check if it would work and the money will be reimbursed.Although the 11$ was reimbursed, I never received any wifi or internet in my room. SAD!!!. Try getting rooms as above as you can to minimize street noises specially ambulance and firetrucks.Parking at the hotel is $52/day.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again for sure!”
Reviews.Author: msditty
Reviews.Content: We reserved this hotel thru priceline.com. We had never used that site before & got this hotel. We were very happy. Especially for the price we paid! It is perfect location to Michigan Ave which is one block up. It is 1 block from the famous Garrett's popcorn! The staff is great all around from the valet, to concierge, hotel front desk, and housekeeping. Everyone is friendly, helpful, and always smiling! The room was clean and spacious. My husband was disappointed there wasn't flat screen TV's but this doesn't bother me. The pool and hot tub were small and crowded so we didn't use them while we were here. The only disappointment was the $10 fee for WI FI. There is a restaurant but we did not eat here, We would stay here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good location, does the job”
Reviews.Author: shabaBelfast
Reviews.Content: Clean, staff friendly. Good location. Breakfast is pretty average for American terms. Rooms are clean. Ticked most of the boxes.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: SteffieB
Reviews.Content: Wow, I have almost the same experience as another writer here, only instead of being in town for a shopping trip, we were here for a medical convention. Roman also greeted me and put me and a colleague in a room on the 17th floor. So friendly! We loved everyone we dealt with at the Wyndham. The beds are great, with wonderful pillows and warm comforters. My colleague used the gym quite a bit. The concierges were also incredibly helpful. I had a weird issue with them wanting to charge the entire stay to my debit card (a shared room) when I checked in (corrected!), and a delayed return of some dry cleaning (found and sent immediately after I called, so quick I didn't even notice it was back), but the service and quality of sleep far surpassed any scant negativity. Even the bellhops bent over backwards to be as accommodating as possible. Really a great hotel stay, and this from someone who likes to stay in B&Bs and pensions, so I consider it high praise myself.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: jcrads
Reviews.Content: The Wyndham is a well located hotel in Streeterville. Ask the bellmen or concierge on advice with where to go, what to do/see, there's so much Chicago has to offer so talk to them. A fantastic stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff, excellent service, great location”
Reviews.Author: JanMacomb
Reviews.Content: My friend and I just returned from a week-end shopping trip to Chicago. We stayed in the Wyndham Hotel on St. Clair. We were immediately greeted at the registration desk by Roman, who went out of his way to make this a great stay for us. He put us into a room on the 17th floor with a beautiful view, recommended stores and restaurants, and always greeted us with a smile. We had the same outstanding service from our concierge, Kristin. She also recommended restaurants and took care of making our reservations and gave us great directions. The room was clean, the view amazing, and the beds really comfortable. The location could not have been better. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Brill!”
Reviews.Author: AnnieM1
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights (room 1723) as part of our 3 centre holiday April 2011. This is a very comfortable hotel in an amazing city. The room was clean, had everything we needed and the location was excellent. Although many reviews make reference to the noise nuisance of sirens at night, we heard only one siren and that was from somewhere on Michigan Ave. As we were leaving for the airport and next leg of our journey, we realised one of our hard-body suitcase had been damaged on the flight over. The staff helped to tape up a huge crack - and it survived the fights on to New Orleans, then Miami and two connecting return flights - it's just been dumped on our return the the UK, so thank you! We found the friendliness and helpfulness of the hotel staff replicated across the city. Enjoyed Corner Bakery breakfast which is directly across the road from the hotel. Will definitely return to Chicago and this hotel. Chicago was the best place we visited on this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not great service”
Reviews.Author: msa23_2000
Reviews.Content: The Wyndham is in a great location with lots of restaurants nearby. The price is of great value, but the service of the staff was simply not good. I wouldn't go as far to say they are rude, as just not nice or accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Still great but updates needed”
Reviews.Author: mtoguchi12
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Wyndham for the fourth time in the last six years, and it's still a nice place. The location is perfect - easy to get to River North restaurants, Magnificent Mile shopping and a quick walk to the Gold Coast. Only downside is the proximity to the medical center, which might wake you up with sirens and whatnot during the night. The rooms are nice, but are sort of "gracefully degrading". They were awesome the first time I was here, with the Herman Miller chairs and the large marble bathroom counters. They're still rockin' the old tube TV's, and the beds weren't quite as comfortable as I remember them. I was really frustrated by the shower, which never got above lukewarm during a four day, three night stay. The gym merits a special shout out - diversity equipment, and not cramped like a lot of hotel gyms. Used it every day. The bar downstairs is great - very spacious, perfect place to work and have a drink if you're their on business. And the front desk staff and concierge were pleasant and helpful every time I interacted with them. I'm a big Wyndham fan so I hope this hotel "freshens up" a bit, lest it fall too far out of step with other nice downtown options.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs, rude staff, and major noise population!”
Reviews.Author: clevelandtraveler16
Reviews.Content: Wow, this hotel had everything you donâ€™t want in a hotel: bed bugs, rude staff, and major noise population! First, the night manager at this hotel- Steve Plascencie â€“ was rude and obnoxious. When I went to inquire about the internet issues- the hotel didn't have internet access for 2 of my 3 days I was there- Steve first rolled his eyes at the staff worker who tried to assist me and the rolled his eyes at me! It is one thing to be rude to me but to belittle a younger colleague in front of me? He clearly gets off on humiliating others. The noise level at this hotel is problematic too. There were sirens blaring all night as it is located next to a hospital. If you stay there, bring a loud white noise machine! Finally, and most disturbing, my children received what we assume to be bed bug bites at this hotel! They were covered in red bites. I was shocked and will never stay at a Wyndham Hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Noisey”
Reviews.Author: DAREINA
Reviews.Content: Perferction location on the Magnificent Mile,but very noisey...hospital is across the street so the sound of ambulances was heard thru out the WHOLE night. Walls are paper thin...you can heard the room next door flush their toliet or take a shower. The pool is very small, no towels were available. The jacuzzi was filled with kids whom didnt even have the jacuzzi on let alone i most likely wouldnt even be able to fit in it with SOOOO many kids in it and it was 9:30pm.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed...”
Reviews.Author: packerman60
Reviews.Content: Great hotel; has everything within walking distance ( Starbucks, pizzia ,resturants )... very impressed with the room ( NICE, CLEAN AND BIG.) The lounge and dining area were very impressive food , drinks. Staff was very curtious and polite. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and That is About It”
Reviews.Author: Kelly2185
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Chicago Wyndham for what was supposed to be two nights in a one bedroom suite. There was nothing but problems and the staff was far from helpful. When I arrived and checked in, the man at the desk said that he was having problems programming the keys. He then sent us up to the tenth floor for our room. We entered into the living room portion of the suite and that is when things started going downhill. The TV was on in the bedroom and as we started walking further into the room, we noticed used towels laying on the floor. My boyfriend tiptoed into the bedroom and when he saw a lump on the bed, we realized that WE HAD BEEN SENT INTO A ROOM THAT WAS ALREADY IN USE! We lugged our heavy luggage back down and informed the man working the desk about what had just happened. He did not seem too concerned. He gave us two breakfast coupons, which I guess was supposed to make us feel better about the bizarre experience that had just occurred. We already had all of our meals planned out and reservations made at the restaurants, so we were not going to be able to use the coupons anyway. Then he goes, 'We'll put you on the ninth floor. It is a corner room, so it is nice.' At this point I am irritated, but I just want to get into a room. We bring our luggage up to the ninth floor and find our room. We walk into a room that is definitely not a one-bedroom suite. I call down and get a woman working the front desk. I ask why I was downgraded to a different room than the one I had reserved. She goes, 'Well, there are no one-bedroom suites left. He already gave you breakfast coupons.' I explained that the breakfast coupons were for the fact that we had walked in on someone's room, now we had a different problem. Not only did he downgrade us, but he didn't even tell us. That is just deceitful. She suggested that we switch rooms the next day. She was rude and sounded completely unconcerned. The next day we had to repack all of our stuff and lug it back down to the lobby. There were different staff working and I explained the situation. They said that we could check our luggage in downstairs and our room would be ready in the afternoon. I asked if they had ever figured out what happened the night before and they just laughed and avoided the question . They then said that they would talk to their manager about it, but I was never contacted by any manager. I am assuming that they never told anyone. We checked our luggage in and went about our day. When we came back, the room was ready. For the third time, we hauled our luggage back up, this time to the fourth floor. It was the right room and no one was in there so that was a small victory. We sat down to relax a bit and watch tv and it wasn't working. We called down to the front desk and you could tell they were irritated. We explained that the tv wasn't working right. A repair man had to come up and change out all of the wires behind the tv and then reprogram it. It was just one more thing to add to the list of problems. The room was rather dirty and I will be adding photos to the review. I had planned this whole weekend for my boyfriend's birthday and all of the problems really put a cloud over our plans. I would have felt so much better if the staff had acted like they cared. Instead they made me feel as though I was being a brat for complaining at all. We used to live in Chicago, so we come back quite frequently to enjoy the city. I can guarantee that we will not be staying at the Wyndham for any future visits. I hope that they can sort these kinds of problems out or they will lose more people.

Reviews.Title: “Charge for internet service.”
Reviews.Author: kdz1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my two teenagers while looking at colleges. I had to work while there. Their internet was $10 a night, and while I was in the middle of a work project my 24 hours expired and my project was completely lost. Ouch. Because my teenagers also used computers I got $30 charge for one night! Fortunately the manager took off the charges. Otherwise the hotel is nice. I am going to be sure I start asking about free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tig2811
Reviews.Content: Our stay started on Thursday March 24th and ended Sunday 27th. Booked thru travelzoo at $129/ with breakfast buffet. Parking included for $30/ day Cons: As many of the others have stated this hotel is near a major hospital. You will hear the ambulances throughout the night. But we knew that going in. One thing the management should place in the rooms are a couple pairs of ear plugs. Pros: Great location one block off Michigan Ave. Staff were very nice and helpful. We were upgraded to suite that was very nice, clean . Large bathroom, the stool is just inside the door so be careful opening the door if someone is using it. The pool area was nice and clean. There was a working steam and sauna. Also there is a hot tub. For our money we would stay here again our next trip to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Not really worth the amount we paid!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: PeruKim
Reviews.Content: No refrigerator or microawave in the room. No free internet service. Had trouble getting clean, dry towels in the pool area - even after asking the towels they brought out were not dry. The only plus that I saw was that it was in a good location. Oh, and my card key quit working, so I had to get it "fixed" as they called it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay- from check in to check out!”
Reviews.Author: havinfun21
Reviews.Content: A group of us, 10 all stayed at The Wyndham on a Saturday night. All of used a Travelzoo deal. My husband and I were upgraded to an Executive Suite, for no additional charge. The room was huge. The rest of our party had Deluxe Corner Suites. The staff was friendly and helpful. The bed was comfortable. The draperies blocked out all of the morning light. We had the breakfast buffet. There pastries, fruit, scrambled eggs, hash brown potatoes, bacon, sausage, juice and coffee. Checkout was for 11 AM. All of us requested and were given a 12 noon checkout at no extra charge. We were able to store our luggage while we went shopping. Parking is $45. With our deal parking was $30 for the night. We were told we could leave our car there until 6pm. None of our group had any complaints. We were all very pleased with our stay. If you have a Wyndham request card is sure to let them know. When we returned to our room Saturday night, we had a bottle of wine, cheese and crackers.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: east12
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent a Friday and Saturday night at the Wyndham. We usually stay at the Hotel Monaco, the Swiss, Renaissance or Talbot but we decided to try the Wyndham due to a great Travelzoo deal. We will definitely stay here again. We had a corner junior suite and enjoyed all the space. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was huge. (I wish that a makeup/shaving mirror had been on the long vanity.) The internet is free to anyone signing up for Wyndham rewards. The concierge went out of his way to be helpful and there was almost always a gathering of tourists seeking his advice. Our package included a free buffet breakfast which was very nice, especially since the hotel was not very crowded over the weekend. Scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage and hash browns were included, as well as mountains of fresh fruit and beautiful muffins and pastries. In summary, it was a great experience for the rate paid but we will always compare deals offered by our favorite hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Will be my go-to hotel in Chicago if not staying in the burbs with family”
Reviews.Author: Betsyat240
Reviews.Content: With this hotel perfectly located and the great rate we got it was a no-brainer to stay here and we certainly were glad we did. The hotel was great and the staff could not have been more friendly and helpful. The rooms were a large size and we LOVED the Herman Miller Aeron chair at the desk. We chose not to drive into the city because of the hotel parking fee we would have been charged that seems extremely high. We didn't miss having a car at all as really everything is walkable.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but will nickel and dime you to death!”
Reviews.Author: NurseN_99
Reviews.Content: I stayed there this weekend and feel it was okay. Pros- It's in an AWESOME location and the concierge were the best! You can walk out of the hotel and be shopping on the Magnificent Mile in one minute. The John Hancock Observatory, Water Tower Place, Milennium Park, American Girl shopping, great restaurants are all within walking distance. I loved this! Cons- The room haf no microwave and no fridge. I was traveling w/ an infant and needed to sterilize her bottles. I called and asked if there was a microwave I could use and was told a flat NO. I then asked if I could have a small amount of dish soap to wash the bottles. The supervisor on duty told me NO. When asked why, he said it was a liability issue. Really? I've traveles with a child on and off for the last 8 yrs and have NEVER had this issue. He said I should walk out to Walgreens 2 blocks away (it was 2 degrees, yes TWO) and get some. I was disgusted!!! What hotel room has NO FRIDGE amd NO Microwave???? Parking is $49 PER DAY. Nearby parking places charge 15. The Business Center is a joke. It costs 0.35 cents a minute to go online on one of their TWO computers. pay for WiFi or pay this outrageous fee. Ridiculous! Throw in the constant ambulance sirens going by and I was done. Dissappointing to say the least.

Reviews.Title: “The nickle and dime you hotel”
Reviews.Author: debberooni
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nothing to write home about. It's convenient to downtown, but they charge for parking and for wi-fi. I expected the beds to be more comfortable but they were anything but. We asked the concierge to help us decide where to eat one night when one of them told us not to go where we had planned to go. The gentleman said he would do it before he left that night and slip it under our door since we were on our way out for the evening, but it never materialized.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with few issues”
Reviews.Author: ConatserFamily
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for a Girls weekend due to the location and proximity to the Miracle Mile. The hotel was nicely decorated with extremely helpful staff. The room was spacious with comfy beds. The bathroom was nice but needed a door to separate the dressing area from the shower. It was difficult to have any privacy. The buffet type breakfast was nice but very overpriced at $15.00 a person. I would suggest grabbing a bite at one of the close restaurants. The only issue I had was with the "American Gir" package. We were required to pay the additional fee for both nights but only received perks for one night. My daughter enjoyed the extras but it was a little pricey. Many reviews discuss the sirens from the hospital. We did not have any issues as it is a big city. I will mention the walls are thin so you could have problems with loud neighbors.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but has gone downhill”
Reviews.Author: Noblehouse53
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the wyndham over christmas holiday for the last four five years and used to enjoy it. This year, however, was disappointing. After a series of small mishaps (initially given the wronhttp://blogs.amctv.com/the-walking-dead/2010/12/robert-kirkman-fan-interview.phpg room type, no My Rewards welcome) the kicker was that someone opened the door to our room early one morning while we were sleeping. I was awakened by the sound of someone fiddling with the door handle, then i heard the door open. I shouted a few times and the person eventually ran off. We reported it immediately but hotel staff was not very interested. A few hours after the incident, we contacted front desk again, and they said it was a hotel staff person that accidentally got the wrong room. If this is really what happened, they should have called us back after we reported us to let us know. After we complained the second time, we were told the manager would call us, but no one ever did. If it was just a staff person (and I'm not convinced of that), they should have let us know instead of letting me sit here shaking with my heart pounding. We barricaded the door with the console table for tonight. As others have mentioned, the facility hasn't been particularly well maintained, with run down carpet, tub faucet separating from the wall, and a stain on the sofa in our room.

Reviews.Title: “At the Wyndham for the Holiday "Tree Lighting" Parade...”
Reviews.Author: playmaker16
Reviews.Content: We took the kids down to the city for the annual tree lighting parade so they could experience the holiday fun. We had a great deal on the room, so we can't complain about that (I know it is regularly pricey). It was 2 full beds and we had enough space with our two kids. The rooms were nice (as I'd expect from a Wyndham), but nothing too special. The staff seemed helpful from what we experienced, but not over the top incredible. Probably the best aspect of the stay is the proximity to Michigan Avenue. It is literally a block outside the front door, surrounded by EVERYTHING (food, shopping, nightlife, etc.). We have definitely stayed at some nicer places, but overall a good experience at the Wyndham.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed and Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: tdub_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Wyndham Chicago for 2 nights. After reading some of the reviews, I was a bit nervous about staying here, but I got a pretty good price from Priceline and I was looking forward to my first experience in a four star hotel, so I decided to give it a try. When I called to confirm my room, the gentlemen who answered the phone was rude and hung up on me before I had a chance to ask him for my confirmation number. Not a good start. The actual check-in went very smooth. I arrived early, the young lady at the desk was very nice and I was able to get an early check in without a problem. I stayed on the 17th floor. The king room is small and not very clean. Even though the beds were very comfortable, there was a HUGE COBWEB right above my bed. Also, I can't believe how old the TVs are. I didn't go to Chicago to watch TV, but it would have been nice to have something decent to watch and one would think since they don't provide free WiFi, they would at least invest in modern TVs, and more channels. After my first night there, I left my room at about 10:15am, after more than four hours of walking and shopping, I wanted to come back to the room charge my cell phone and relax a bit before going back out for dinner and a show. I arrived back to the room at about 2:45pm and the room had not been cleaned. Housekeeping walked in within 10m of my arrival to begin cleaning, so of course I was not comfortable staying there watching them clean, so I went back out. Also, the faucet on the bathroom sink was loose to the point that I thought it may actually come completely off. On the plus side, the restaurant downstairs makes a GREAT steakburger and the bartender, (I've forgotten his name) makes a great cosmo and was very helpful with information about nearby jazz clubs and even gave me a free pass to Backstage. On past visits to Chicago, I have stayed at the Courtyard Marriott Downtown Mag Mile, which is right across the street from the back of this building, and Hilton Garden Inn on Grand St. I would stay at one of these hotels again before booking at the Wyndham.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent option for the Magnificent Mile”
Reviews.Author: Escapefromthedesert
Reviews.Content: I visted the Wyndam when I ran the Chicago Marathon. I was able to get a great rate and and overall was satisifed with my stay. We took the train into Chicago from O'Hare, it was inexpensive and fairly easy. you will have to be prepared to walk allot of stairs. I was going to rent a car, but was glad I didn't as parking is difficult and very expensive in the city. In addition, if you are not a seasoned city driver I would caution against that plan. Checkin was quick the front desk agent was friendly, responsive and extremely helpful. The hotel's location is right next to a hospital, so there will be random sounds of sirens occuring through your stay. I requested a room on the highest floor which alleviated any intrustions. The room was clean and the bed comfortable. One problem was that we were next to a linen room, so there were occasional sounds of a door slamming, luckliy that was only during the day. The housekeeing was great, I room was always prompt and might my high standards. I did not eat in the hotel as there are several inexpensive eating options across the street and within a 5 minute walk. The work-out rooms had adequate equipment and was operating, The concierge desk was very helpful and had a great attiude even when busy as the hotel was full due to the marathon and a convention. The location is great as you are in walking distance to the magnificant mile, the Sears tower, Navy Pier, Grant Park and you are a short walk to the Metro which will get you to greek Town and other interesting neighborhoods. The Wyndham was a pleasant suprise to my run at the Marathon.

Reviews.Title: “Basically good, lacking a few small tweaks to make it excellent”
Reviews.Author: BobHarvey
Reviews.Content: Well situated in a nice part of town. Contrary to other reviews we didn't find the hospital opposite made much noise. Particularly comfortable beds, but the hotel as a whole fails in a few luxury touches that could easily be tweaked and probably should be expected in this class of hotel. Our bathroom was very large, yet had no separate shower, only a puzzlingly low-mounted and rather puny shower over the tub, and the toiletries were of rather mediocre quality. The restaurant seemed to have lots of staff, and claimed to be upmarket, yet had a very limited and constant menu, and the one time we tried it two burgers took ages and though the fries were hot the burgers were nearly cold. The bar had no draft beer and was in near total darkness - this may have made the TV easier to watch, but seemed a bit low-rent in a good hotel. And, as many other reviews point out, they charge for the internet, and it PER DEVICE so if you want to use an Iphone or Ipad too, it'll cost you twice. As a general point, I note that the more expensive the hotel the more likely, and the more, they charge for internet access - I can only guess they presume businessmen can charge it so dont care. It's a good safe choice, but just a bit too bland for the price point.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: redwine16
Reviews.Content: lovely hotel in an excellent central location. Busy! only down side was the sound of the sirens from the ambulances going to the adjacent hospital a&e oh and the Chinese receptionist who struggled to understand my English, i am from England after all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Good location”
Reviews.Author: sherzyb
Reviews.Content: Pros: The hotel staff was excellent, especially to conceirge - their recommendations were spot on. The room was spacious and clean, the bed very comfortable. Nice location - 1 block from Miracle Mile, a few blocks from Navy pier. Nice workout area and hot tub Cons: Located across from hospital - sirens all night long Shower/tub and television a bit out-dated.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant service, very comfortable and great location.”
Reviews.Author: AngelaBax
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a visit to Chicago where we stayed at the Wyndham Hotel just off North Michigan Ave for 3 nights and were very impressed with the level of service and friendly staff. The hotel is very comfortable, at a reasonable rate, and right in the middle of all the best shopping. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A sad excuse for a Wyndham hotel”
Reviews.Author: DGregory1
Reviews.Content: I travel to Chicago often and was very disappointed with this property. The property is located next to the emergency entrance of a major hospital. Sirens from emergency vehicles can be heard at all hours of the day and night. Whether trying to get a bite to eat at a sidewalk cafe or trying to get a good nights rest you can not get away from the constant noise in this area. Do not expect a courtesy call to your cell if your room is not ready when you arrive. The room was not cleaned well, the carpets were stained and the walls are thin but the view was tremendous. Even though the rooms have been recently updated the furniture and electronics are outdated. While entering the hotel I stumbled on a section of the sidewalk that had raised about two inches and fell. While getting up with a bloody knee and elbow the doorman stood there and clapped without offering any assistance or concern. Expect to pay extra for every conceivable convenience even down to the paper you print on in the guests business center. This property and it's staff in no way deserves a four star rating.

Reviews.Title: “VERY nice, highly recommend..”
Reviews.Author: carrie96
Reviews.Content: we originally booked <thru EXPEDIA> a stay at the TREMONT in Chicago.. after reading reviews.. i booked an additional room for 2/nites @ the WYNDHAM. couldn't have been more pleased with WYNDHAM. we asked 'FOR A VIEW'.. she upgraded it to a room w/ a view.. i then asked if the hotel wasn't very booked if ANOTHER UPgrade was possible. it was, for no charge we received an <endroom>, much more spacious, huge window facing west and south.. no need to use conceirge, but saw many customers were.. we didn't dine there, as so many other options... great room service, comfy BEDS.. HUGE bathroom.. definitely will visit again.. asked for a later checkout via the front desk, was not a problem.. (( from the AIRPORT -o'hara-- we book the blue line train... $2/person.. dropped us off approx. 10 blocks from hotel )) it's fun/// fast... chose the LAKE/CLARK exit if you use the BLUE LINE /subway... WYNDHAM ROCKS -2 block walk to GINO'S EAST (we chose CALL in//CARRY-OUT), one block to MICHGAN AVE.. too bad it is not wi-fi friendly.. but the CORNER BAKERY across the street is where everybody seems to head.. :)) great coffeee...

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel - Great Concierge!”
Reviews.Author: Mandaroo11
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 days in Chicago - first time. The rooms were very nice & clean, the rate was great and it was right in the heart of Chicago. 1 block from the Miracle Mile and we walked everywhere. The El station was a few blocks away and a little known tidbit we got 1 Day Fun Passes for $5.25 for 24 hours of riding the El! The Concierge's (which we have never used before in a hotel) were extremely helpful and even gave us a 20% coupon for the restaurant we asked directions to! Couldn't have been more pleased - can't wait to go back.......a definite A++++

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: NorthDakota
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in August with mom and daughter....room was very nice, no problems with housekeeping. We did hear sirens, but once asleep they certainly didn't wake us. Concierge was VERY helpful!! Room was very good sized and bathroom was HUGE! Location was 1 block off of Michigan -- well within walking distance to many sites. Got a very reasonable rate off of Expedia. Would stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but some disappointment”
Reviews.Author: mierman1
Reviews.Content: We booked a king room through Expedia and to start, were told that this wasn't guaranteed if you booked through a site besides their own so we were given a double room. We were offered to upgrade for $60 a night to a suite but declined. Like others noted, the location is good if you don't mind the loud sirens. We were on the top floor and they still woke us at night. The $10.95 per CONNECTION for internet is an extortionate joke - I'm sorry, but Motel 6 offers this in their $30 hotel rooms - for the kind of money the Wyndham charges, this should be a given in 2010. The maid service was also frustrating - linens not changed, not getting new sugar and creamer refills the next day after we'd used the coffee machine, etc. We did not use the concierge - it did look like alot did and they seemed friendly but we didn't get any of the offers, perks or special treatment that others described. Other than the hospital, the location is good for Michigan Avenue and getting around on the bus. The room was good sized other than not getting a king bed as reserved. Wasn't the worst but won't be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with a great location!”
Reviews.Author: WindsorTenor
Reviews.Content: The Wyndham is located 1 block from the Magnificent Mile and between Erie and Ontario Streets. This location puts it in the middle of all the action of "downtown" Chicago. Check in was smooth and friendly. The room was both spacious and very clean. The bathroom was larger than normal and stocked very well with amenities and towels. The ONLY drawback of this hotel is the internet. Come on Wyndham. This is the 21st century. $10.95 for an internet connection? Even the The Corner Bakery across the street offers their customers free wifi!

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend!”
Reviews.Author: MrsHillToronto
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to travel to Chicago for our very 1st wedding anniversary, so glad we did because they really took care of us. Flew into Midway on Porter Airlines and it was very easy to get a shuttle to our hotel. Check in was also easy but then again we did arrive after 9pm so we didn't expect any line ups anyways. Dropped off our luggage then went down to concierge to ask for a pub to grab a bite to eat. They recommended the irish pub around the corner call Timothy O'Tools and even gave us a coupon. Then next day they helped my husband out by finding a nice steak house called Benny's for our anniversary dinner and even went the extra mile and sent up a bottle of bubbly to our room to celebrate....Thank you Krista or Kristin, you rock! Overall, our trip was fantastic! Great service, great room, great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Lots of hotels could learn from the Wyndham”
Reviews.Author: wefstag
Reviews.Content: This is a well located top hotel well run by friendly well organised staff. If you wanted to spend double you might get better, but only might. The one downside is the noise at night, as described by others. But not a big problem for us as having been made aware of the situation we asked for a room on an upper floor. After the first night we were OK. If I were the manager I would certainly question the need for seemingly every ambulance to use their sirens at night - but I would not wish this comment to overstate the issue,

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ruinair
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in July. The hotel is in a fantastic location just a minute's walk from the Magnificent Mile. Our room was spacious and clean. The concierge service was especially helpful. The pool was small but rarely crowded. Chicago is a truly captivaing city with buckets of attractions to see and do for all ages. Book this hotel, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: ckcMIami
Reviews.Content: The location is great, the staff friendlinesshelpfujness was great However the sirens from the hospital across the street was annoying, you could hear them all through the night. The $10.00 deal in the restaurant can"t be beat, only ate there once, wish I had a chance to ty all ten! Would recommend staying there for a good deal, not full price. Also the Corner Bakery across the street was delicious. If you have a vehicle get ready to pay $50.00 per day for parking!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-1 Block off Mag. Mile”
Reviews.Author: JTAkron
Reviews.Content: The location is the best if you enjoy spending time along Michigan Ave., with all of the shops and Water TowerPlace (1 block West and 2 blocks North). Rooms are comfy (bed and pillows are nice and bathroom is large). TV is small by todays standards (27"). Parking is valet parking at $49/day. Has bar/restaurant and concierge, but we didn't utilize. This is our 2nd trip here in past 3 years and would stay here again. Got great price at last minute on Expedia ($149/night for a Sunday night stay). Layout is a little strange with actual check-in on 2nd floor and needing to use 2 elevators to get from the streetlevel to your room. Recommend The Corner Bakery, which is a restaurant accross street from Hotel. They open at 6:30am and have nice assortment of hot and cold breakfast choices, coffee, pastries. The French Toast is awesome. This is located next to Northwestern Univ.-College of Medicine and the Hospital is adjacent, so there are a number of sirens from the ambulances coming through.

Reviews.Title: “Fine if you get a good deal”
Reviews.Author: msa75
Reviews.Content: We got a good rate for our stay at the Wyndham, and I was happy with it for that rate. I wouldn't pay full price for it. It claims to be a 4-star hotel, and if it is, it's on the low end of 4 stars. Everything was just fine, but it was nothing special. We asked for a quiet room and got one. We had drainage problems with the shower, but when we complained they fixed it right away. If you read that they have a pool, know that the "pool" is about 10 feet by 30 feet. Tiny! If you read that they have refrigerators in the rooms, they don't. The rooms have only mini bars that are so packed you can use the fridge for anything else. The TV was a 27" CRT. PROS: -minutes from the best part of Michigan Ave (Magnificent Mile) -huge bathroom -hotel restaurant had good lunch deals for $10 (although we never tried them) CONS: -directly beside a major hospital, so you hear sirens all of the time -shower head was low (although removable) and there was very little shower pressure -check in time was later than most places: 4pm -check out time was earlier than most places: 11am -no fridge or safe in the room -room was a bit small

Reviews.Title: “WHAT A FIND - WAY TO GO!”
Reviews.Author: dorkozak
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel due to its free parking rates and a discount on the internet. WHAT A SURPRISE! Phenomenal room (they upgraded for free - gorgeous view of downtown Chicago), fantastic beds, they asked for our needs while we were there (restaurants, child accommodations, tours/tour coupons - you name it). And the BREAKFAST BAR ROCKED! I am not one for buffets, and I can say honestly that this food was fresh, plentiful, and fantastic! Loved our stay, loved the service, felt like we were pampered, treasured guests (in complete contrast to a Westin experience I had not a week later) and would stay again in a heartbeat. Great hotel bar downstairs with nice wine selection, and right across the street from so many restaurants, shopping options, and nightlife. But the best part? THE SERVICE. Hands down. With a two year old toddler in tow (and multiple adults with kids staying with us) we all agreed it was GREAT. Totally opened my eyes to the Wyndham as a hotel chain that I would deliberately seek out to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money (large parking fee!). Some annoyances. Nice location though.”
Reviews.Author: DiscerningTravelerMD
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very nice location, close to Michigan Avenue. The lobby of the building is well maintained and the staff all seemed polite. I stayed here for a wedding. The service during the wedding was not very good. It was slow. We had butter, butter knives, and bread plates, alas, bread was never served. The food was decent. Our room was on the 7th floor. As another commentor noted, there were some random banging noises during our stay there as well. One of the annoying things about the room was that there were no light-occluding curtains. The only functioning curtain was a white sheer thing that let quite a bit of light in. We were up at 5am due to this bright light. The TV channel selection was only average. The real shocker was the next morning when I went to pay for parking. I was charged $50 for overnight (1 night) parking. I am from Chicago and this is a total rip-off. It should have been $20 at the most. Room service was ridiculously expensive as well: $15 for toast and juice or coffee. Given these drawbacks, I cannot recommend this hotel in good conscience. Caveat emptor.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: travellovers777
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Chicago Wyndham Hotel was the best. We had a spacious 700 square foot king suite that was amazing. The bed was extremely comfortable. We made good use of the pool, hot tub, steam and sauna. Our package deal included both valet parking and the breakfast buffet. The buffet had a large selection of fresh fruit and baked goods. We looked forward to it each morning. The staff was always very friendly and helpful. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “awesome view / horrible view”
Reviews.Author: winterlight37
Reviews.Content: The Wyndham is a nice hotel. Service was fine. The rooms were big but the decor was dated (armoire with TV). Initially we were given a room that looked out into a brown block wall. We asked for a change, and thankfully, we were moved to a room that looked out over Michigan Avenue. From depressing to magnificent in ten minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Wyndham Chicago--a must for American Girl Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: cnc123
Reviews.Content: I recently traveled to Chicago with my 6 year old daughter, a friend, and her 8 year old daughter to visit American Girl Place. I had researched hotels that offered an "American Girl Place Package", and decided on the Wyndham, and was so glad that I did! The package was very reasonable, considering we split the cost of the room, and included great amenities for the girls, including a travel doll bed, blanket, & pillow, full size keepsake Wyndham Chicago pillowcase, a pink Wyndham sleep mask, and a pink striped popcorn tin filled complimentary at Garrett's popcorn store just down the street--all to bring home with them! The website's package ammenities are for one child, but for $50 more you can get all the same things for additional children. The girls were thrilled, and we were very impressed with the quality of all the items as well as the hotel. Another great thing is the hotel's indoor pool, and the fact that American Girl Place is only 4 blocks away. This hotel is right in the middle of it all, has a very accomodating staff, and was the perfect place to stay for our American Girl Getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel just needs more furniture for clothes”
Reviews.Author: PvrUncleM
Reviews.Content: Had a 5 night stay at the hotel with my wife and had a great time, the location is perfect, just a block away from Michigan Avenue, plenty of restaurants and shopping nearby, several attractions within walking distance, it's a shame that the hospital is very close and you hear sirens every now and then. I had issues trying to fit our clothes in the room, because besides from the closet that has no drawers there aren't any furniture to serve this purpose and had to use our suitcase most of the time, getting newer tv's might be a good idea although I hardly used it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: crose75
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in March. The location is good, just a little bit off of Michigan Avenue, so it's be great for a shopping expedition. The check in was quick, but the desk staff weren't very personable. The room itself was very nice, with excellent beds and bedding. We were at the end of a hall, so there wasn't any noise to speak of, and even though we were on a lower floor, there wasn't any street noise either. Beware the hotel bar though. Two drinks were $25! I got this room at a great rate on cheapostay.com so I thought it was a very good value for what I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Small Standard Room”
Reviews.Author: lexcinnati
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in March, disappointed by the size of the room and was supposed to get a free upgrade, but had no rooms of that type available.Old school t.v., basic shower, view of an alley.Breakfast and parking were included in our rate which made up for the other things this hotel lacks.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: Yorkshire77
Reviews.Content: For a 4 start hotel we were shocked and disappointed, mainly due to the constant banging noises that came somewhere within the 7th floor area, it wasn't a noise from banging door's, like you would expect, it was as if the internal steel works within the construction of the building were being banged, this occured at random times hroughout the night and day, the rooms were far from spotless. Great location though!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, and toddler loved it.”
Reviews.Author: IndyEdit
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, and our two-year-old daughter, just stayed at the Wyndham for a weekend of shopping and meeting up with friends. The hotel is lovely and well-run, and our room was very clean and comfortable. We stayed in a single guest room with one bed and brought a portable crib for our daughter. There was plenty of room for the crib, and the single bed was very comfortable -- we all slept well. The room wasn't fancy but had everything we needed. The fitness center, including the pool, is small but well stocked with equipment, towels, etc. The hotel restaurant also offers a VERY nice breakfast buffet. The hotel is very conveniently located -- within walking distance of Water Tower Place, shopping, restaurants, etc. -- also close to bus stops for getting to Navy Pier and the museums. It's also very close to the local hospital; so there were sirens during the night, but it the noise didn't bother us too much. The hotel staff were also very courteous and helpful, and very friendly to our daughter, which we appreciated -- she obviously felt very comfortable at the Wyndham. We loved our stay at the Wyndham and plan to stay there again on our next trip to Chicago. The only quibble about our visit: If you drive to or in this part of Chicago, parking is very, very expensive -- $50 a night or more in some places, easy. We saved $30 off our weekend parking by leaving our car in a parking garage in a business building next to the Wyndham, instead of using the Wyndham's parking service.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: harryt
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights with family last weekend.Great location,only 1 block from Michigan Ave,can walk to lot of attractions or get a bus from Michigan Ave.Lots or restaurants near-by.Rooms were bigger than some I ve stayed in,kept spotlessly clean.Staff were very helpful and friendly.Only used the restaurant once on the last day and regretted not having visited before.Expensive for dinner but lunch menu for $10 good value.Would definitely stay here again and would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at Wyndham”
Reviews.Author: digginthedirt
Reviews.Content: We'd ever have guessed such a gem was tucked into this building !! The King Executive Suite we booked was spacious, comfortable and well appointed. Upon arrival we were a bit nervous because the valet area was small and crowded. That was the only glitch of our 2 night stay. We ate delicious meals --1 breakfast and 1 room service dinner and we met many wonderful and friendly people. The walk to the many shops on Michigan Ave is only 1 block away. The pool is not large but even when others were swimming we had fun. This hotel was priced right, located perfectly and served all our needs as a family. I read reviews that mentioned ambulance noise --we never noticed it in our room. We did hear them on occasion as we entered or exited the hotel. We will stay here again !!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: micnoone
Reviews.Content: Stayed with 5 friends for a christmas weddding, lovely hotel , found concierge & staff very friendly and helpful. Rooms were spacious and clean. Noise from Ambulance Sirens from nearby hospital woke me on a couple of occasions at nite but didnt take away at all from an enjoyable stay. One thing to look out for is the breakfast is expensive, nice restaurant across the road for breakfast will save a few dollars.

Reviews.Title: “Great Chicago value and location”
Reviews.Author: CritiquerCA
Reviews.Content: This hotel, located in River North, is a great value (we paid $120/night for room, parking and breakfast included--this was a special rate, don't think parking is usually included) and I would definitely stay here again. It's just a block off Michigan Avenue for great shopping and a perfect base for enjoying River North. Rooms are well appointed and comfortable, and the breakfast buffet was really nice (hot and cold dishes, cereals, fruit, pastries, breads and great organic brewed coffee) with great service. The gym is small but adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Review...”
Reviews.Author: Hillaryb0224
Reviews.Content: Hotel itself was nice. Concierge was great as well as the staff in the bar/restaurant. The staff at the front desk were horrible!!!! We waited 1 1/2 hours passed our check in time and finally I went up there for the third time and they had a room ready for us. Hotel was beautiful, rooms were nothing special, hotel was close to everything...including the hospital across the street that has ambulances with sirens leaving and arriving all times of the night! Ugh.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great weekend rates”
Reviews.Author: TedERhodeIsland
Reviews.Content: Impressive, well maintained. Room was large with desk and armoire/tv. Staff is very helpful and friendly. The front desk in a word, reserved. There are several breakfast stops within 1 to 2 block walking distance, Corner Bakery, West Egg Cafe and Einstein Bros. Bagels. Corner Bakery is across the street and opens at 6AM, for the first coffee of the day. Great baked goods.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, would return”
Reviews.Author: canadianlady14
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, great location, minutes away from the Magnificent Mile. Our rooms were nice and big (deluxe room) and the only thing I could really complain about was the noise of the ambulances at night, but that is just due to the proximity of the hotel to the hospital. Our room was on the 17th floor so the noise wasn't terrible, but I could definitely hear them at night, however, they did not keep me up, I was just awake when they passed by, others in my party didn't know what I was talking about the next morning when I asked about it, they slept through the night with no problems. It was also a little annoying that you had to enter the hotel and then take one set of elevators to get to the main floor where the other set of elevators were located to take you to your rooms. But overall a very enjoyable stay, friendly staff, nothing of note to complain about. I would definitely return to this hotel on my next visit to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price and Location”
Reviews.Author: MDLady20774
Reviews.Content: I booked the Wyndham for the weekend of 10/30/09 thru 11/1/09 on Expedia for 99.00 (nonrefundable) per night and the hotel's website was charging 215.00 (nonrefundable) per night, so I got a great deal and was very happy about that. Upon arrival the staff was very friendly and more than willing to help. At the check in desk the clerk told me I could upgrade to a suite for 30.00 per night so I did. The room was adequate, the furniture to me is a little out dated. The TV could also use an upgrade to a flat screen. Oh... And valet parking is 50.00 per night, so be prepared to pay. Luckily we found street parking and left the car there the entire weekend. Other than that minor complaint, the location was great, again, the staff was very friendly, and the bed was super comfortable. I definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good location - good rate - well appointed”
Reviews.Author: boatmusdir
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent location, with friendly helpful staff (espec concierge) and well appointed and well maintained rooms. The beds and bed linen were especially comfortable and clean. Having to pay for wireless internet in the room was a little galling, but on a rate of UKÂ£85 per night one can't complain. Excellent inexpensive breakfast to be had just across the street at the Corner Bakery - the cognoscenti of Chicago were inside enjoying Anaheim scramblers and everlasting coffee.Recommend both hotel and the Bakery..!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but made to feel we did not belong”
Reviews.Author: AadVn
Reviews.Content: Took our family to Chicago for a short sightseeing trip in October. Stayed at Wyndham for 3 nights in two rooms. Upon arrival our booking was messed up to the point that we were given the keys to someone else's room. Going back to the desk did not even prompt an apology! Throughout front desk treated us as if we weren't good enough. As a By Request member, I had expected a very different treatment. Value was sadly lacking and prices for parking or breakfast were outrageous, when staff were more busy talking to one another, than attending to clients.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location -you just can't beat it!”
Reviews.Author: AussiesfromSydney
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights & got what we felt after staying, to be an excellent deal via hotwire.com for $88pn. I've go to say -I was alittle concerned & apprehensive about staying here, thanks to all the other reviews & people's honesty about the place. We are Aussies and arrived early(11am) having travelled approx 18 hrs. Firstly: Check in is not on the ground floor, you need to take the lift up a floor. We were greeted by a friendly gentleman & explained why we were here early. He actually asked if we wanted a high or lower floor.! I was "armed' with all the reviews "dont's" so I was prepared to argue/fight to get a room on a higher floor, so no noise & we could sleep. He offered us a room on the 17th floor with a king bed, so we took it. I didn't have to say a word - he must have sensed I was well prepared & very jetlagged, so don't argue with a tired Aussie! Unfortunately, our room wouldn't be ready until 3pm, but he suggested we come back at 2.30pm & they'd see what they could do. The gentleman recognised us straight away & advised our room was ready. The room was clean, tidy with a limited view & the bed was very comfortable. The best part was - we DIDN'T HEAR any sirens from the ambulances at the hospital.! The hotel doesn't have a pick-up service & no free Internet. Secondly: The location was great - easy walk to Michigan Ave, the Magnificent Mile, Navy Pier etc, we walked everywhere & there is a tourist information just up the road near the Water Tower. Shopping is on your doorstep & there are some great restaurants, so venture out as we didn't eat in the hotel. It wasn't windy at all for early Sept, & we went Chicago Beach for lunch, where there is a great cafe/restaurant right on the beach. If you get a sunny day its excellent down there- a good feed & some cold beers (made us feel at home- except no waves at the "beach"). The moral to this story is - if you get a higher floor, you won't hear the sirens. If you are a light sleeper, I'd consider elsewhere. Or just take a gamble like we did as it was only for 2 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Great Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Ezza25
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as part of a Hotel Special hoping for the best. When we arrived we were thrilled to find a centrally located and glamourous hotel. The fixtures and rooms are lovely. Staff are friendly and did their utmost to make our stay. Shopping is on your doorstep as are some great resturants. We went to a Brazilian resturant and rate it as the best meal of the 2 week stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Jog”
Reviews.Author: thomasdn
Reviews.Content: My elderly relatives visited us from abroad. They got here a day ahead of schedule and my wife booked them into the Wyndham Chicago. They spoke no English. My wife called ahead to tell the desk to expect them. When my relatives arrived the front desk took care of them without any trouble. A nice hotel, to be sure, but it was the extra effort that impressed me, and my relatives. Thanks guys.

Reviews.Title: “Great locatio ideal for a tourist”
Reviews.Author: loversScotland
Reviews.Content: Perfect location to see everthing in Chicago. We used to Mero and walked to get around and had no issues. Hotel is clean and staff helpful. We didn't eat in the hotel as Chicago has far too many great restauranrts to miss. Love Chicago and thought this hotel was a great base and worth the money. Their is a very small pool a bit disapointing. The jacuzzi and steam and sauna made uo for it as this helps ease the feet after a long day sight seeing. We did not hear any noise and had great sleeps in a really comfy bed.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful customer service”
Reviews.Author: PenguinNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: We had a block of rooms at the Wyndham for our wedding. All of the Wyndham employees we dealt with were extremely accommodating, helpful, friendly, kind and professional. The hotel is beautiful and in a perfect location in Chicago. Affordable and chic.

Reviews.Title: “It's just average.”
Reviews.Author: NgThH
Reviews.Content: I think the price is not cheap. The hotel doesn't have pick-up serice, & no free Internet. It's $11.00 per day for Internet access. I didn't wanna pay for it since I only need to use the Internet for like 1-2 hours per day just to check email.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Could Use Some Updating”
Reviews.Author: ord2002
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 2 nights over the Labor Day weekend. Booked an executive suite online at wyndham.com. Rate was not cheap, but we wanted more space than a normal city hotel. The room was very large, although the there was not enough furniture for the size of the room. The room, furniture and TV was quite outdated for the price of the hotel. The best feature of this hotel is the great location, just one block from Michigan Avenue. Overall, this is a basic hotel - clean and safe. The staff could have been friendlier and more welcoming - but that is usual in a big city hotel. I would recommend parking at one of the nearby lots at Northwestern Hospital, as the valet parking is $50/night and takes about 20-30 minutes to retrieve your car.

Reviews.Title: “Will Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: bakemanstl
Reviews.Content: Awesome hotel. Convenient to Michigan Ave. and bus routes to all museums. Conceirge Russell is top notch, always helpful with a travel tip on saving time and/or money. Rooms are big and beds are nice, especially after a long day in Chicago. Will Stay there again when in Chicago

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good service”
Reviews.Author: cornflks
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the location. Easy to walk just about anywhere on Michigan Ave, Gold Coast, Millenium Park. Great TravelZoo rate included breakfast. Parking a bit expensive at $49 a night. Cheaper parking within walking distance to hotel. Friendly staff. Got the runaround a bit when trying to connect to internet. As a Wyndham Rewards member, internet should be free. Hotel blamed internet provider, internet provider blamed Wyndham. After 20 minutes, problem solved.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Chicago stay”
Reviews.Author: jingle1
Reviews.Content: Our hotel stay was fantastic. Service and the staff was very friendly. The room was very clean. We recommend this hotel. Very good location.

Reviews.Title: “Unremarkable”
Reviews.Author: benthere
Reviews.Content: I was wondering how I felt about this hotel and I decided that I didn't feel much of anything. Sometimes when I travel, there is something about a hotel or inn that impresses me. This hotel didn't impress me much. Before this gets to sounding too negative, I should be clear that it didn't impress me in a good or bad way. It was very well situated, my room was very clean and the bellmen were very pleasant. I felt that the restaurant, room service and mini bar were very expensive - even by hotel standards. The fitness center and pool were okay. I reached the concierge once in 4 attempts by phone and on that occasion I was on hold for so long that I hung up. You probably need to speak to the concierge in person in order to avail yourself of their assistance.
